title: The Book of Genesis Decoded
author: Brittany Johnson
description: Every sentence of the King James Version of Genesis translated into modern, plain English with contextual clarification.

verses.kjv: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
verses.decoded: At the very start, God created everything: the heavens and the earth.
verses.context: This verse establishes God as the source of creation. It’s about authority and origin, not a scientific explanation of how creation happened.

verses.kjv: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
verses.decoded: The earth existed, but it was unformed and empty. Darkness covered the deep waters, and God’s Spirit hovered over the surface.
verses.context: Creation begins in a state of disorder and emptiness. The Spirit of God moving over the waters signals preparation and intention, like the world is being readied for structure.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
verses.decoded: God spoke a command for light to exist, and light came into being immediately.
verses.context: God creates through His word. Light represents the beginning of order, clarity, and separation from darkness.

verses.kjv: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
verses.decoded: God saw that the light was good, and He separated the light from the darkness.
verses.context: “Good” means it was functional and served its purpose. Separation is how order is created, and it becomes a repeating pattern throughout the chapter.

verses.kjv: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
verses.decoded: God named the light Day and the darkness Night. This completed the first cycle of creation.
verses.context: Naming shows authority. “Evening and morning” marks a completed stage, showing the creation process is unfolding in organized phases.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
verses.decoded: God commanded a space to form between the waters, separating waters below from waters above.
verses.context: Ancient people pictured the sky as a structure separating upper waters from lower waters. The verse is communicating separation and structure, not modern atmospheric science.

verses.kjv: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
verses.decoded: God established that separation, dividing the waters below from the waters above, and it was done.
verses.context: This repeats the idea of boundaries. God is organizing creation into layers and order.

verses.kjv: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
verses.decoded: God named that space Heaven, and this completed the second stage of creation.
verses.context: “Heaven” here refers to the sky or upper realm, not the afterlife. The focus is still structure and separation.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
verses.decoded: God commanded the waters to gather into one place so that dry land could appear, and it happened.
verses.context: Dry land represents stability and a place where life can thrive. Creation is becoming habitable.

verses.kjv: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.
verses.decoded: God named the dry land Earth and the gathered waters Seas, and He saw that it was good.
verses.context: Naming shows order and definition. The environment is now functional and ready for life.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
verses.decoded: God commanded the earth to produce vegetation: grass, plants that make seed, and fruit trees that reproduce after their kind, and it happened.
verses.context: This introduces reproduction and sustainability. Life is being designed to continue, not just appear once.

verses.kjv: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
verses.decoded: The earth produced vegetation exactly as described, and God saw that it was good.
verses.context: The repetition confirms completion. The system of growth and reproduction is now established.

verses.kjv: And the evening and the morning were the third day.
verses.decoded: This completed the third stage of creation.
verses.context: This marks the close of another ordered phase.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:
verses.decoded: God commanded lights to appear in the sky to separate day from night and to mark seasons, days, and years.
verses.context: These lights are created with purpose: to establish time, rhythm, and structure for life on earth.

verses.kjv: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
verses.decoded: These lights were placed in the sky to shine on the earth, and it happened.
verses.context: This reinforces their function: illumination and order.

verses.kjv: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
verses.decoded: God made two major lights: one to govern the day and one to govern the night, and He made the stars too.
verses.context: The lights are described by their role. The focus is purpose, not scientific terminology.

verses.kjv: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
verses.decoded: God placed them in the sky to give light to the earth below.
verses.context: This repeats the purpose again for emphasis.

verses.kjv: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
verses.decoded: They were set to govern day and night and to separate light from darkness, and God saw that it was good.
verses.context: “Rule” means to function as a governing system. Separation continues to be the method God uses to bring order.

verses.kjv: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
verses.decoded: This completed the fourth stage of creation.
verses.context: Time, rhythm, and cycles are now in place.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
verses.decoded: God commanded the waters to fill with living creatures and the sky to fill with birds flying above the earth.
verses.context: Life is now introduced into the environment God prepared in earlier stages.

verses.kjv: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
verses.decoded: God created sea life in abundance, including great sea creatures, and every kind of bird, and He saw that it was good.
verses.context: “After their kind” emphasizes order and design. Life is diverse and intentional.

verses.kjv: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
verses.decoded: God blessed them and commanded them to reproduce and multiply, filling the seas and the earth.
verses.context: This is the first blessing in the Bible. God builds creation with the ability to expand and thrive.

verses.kjv: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
verses.decoded: This completed the fifth stage of creation.
verses.context: Another ordered cycle closes, now with life active in sea and sky.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
verses.decoded: God commanded the earth to bring forth land animals: livestock, creeping things, and wild animals, each after their kind, and it happened.
verses.context: The land is now being filled with living creatures. Again, the categories show structure and order.

verses.kjv: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
verses.decoded: God made wild animals, livestock, and every creeping thing, each according to its kind, and He saw that it was good.
verses.context: The repetition confirms completion. The land ecosystem is now functioning as intended.

verses.kjv: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
verses.decoded: God said, “Let us make mankind in our image and likeness,” and give them authority over the animals of the sea, sky, land, and everything that moves on the earth.
verses.context: This is a major turning point. Humans are introduced as image-bearers with responsibility. Dominion is stewardship, not permission to destroy.

verses.kjv: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
verses.decoded: God created humanity in His own image. Both male and female were created as image-bearers.
verses.context: This verse highlights human worth and identity. The image of God is not limited to one gender.

verses.kjv: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
verses.decoded: God blessed humanity and commanded them to multiply, fill the earth, bring it under order, and govern every living thing.
verses.context: This is both blessing and assignment. “Subdue” reflects cultivating and organizing the earth, not harming it.

verses.kjv: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
verses.decoded: God told them He provided every seed-bearing plant and every fruit-bearing tree as food.
verses.context: God establishes provision before humans ever ask. The design is abundance, not lack.

verses.kjv: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
verses.decoded: God also provided green plants as food for animals, and it was established.
verses.context: Creation is designed with provision for all living creatures. God’s system includes balance and care.

verses.kjv: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
verses.decoded: God looked at everything He created, and it was not just good, but very good. This completed the sixth stage.
verses.context: “Very good” signals full completion. Nothing is missing, nothing is broken, and everything is functioning as intended.

verses.kjv: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
verses.decoded: Everything in creation was completed, including the heavens, the earth, and everything living within them.
verses.context: This verse confirms that creation wasn’t partial or incomplete. “Host” means the full collection of everything God made.

verses.kjv: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
verses.decoded: By the seventh day, God finished His work and stopped working, resting from everything He created.
verses.context: God didn’t rest because He was tired. He rested because the work was complete. Rest is shown as part of God’s design.

verses.kjv: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.
verses.decoded: God blessed the seventh day and set it apart as holy because it was the day He rested after completing creation.
verses.context: This is the first time something is called holy in the Bible. Rest is introduced as sacred, not optional.

verses.kjv: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,
verses.decoded: This is the account of the heavens and the earth when they were created, when the LORD God made the earth and the heavens.
verses.context: The writing shifts here. Genesis moves from a wide creation overview into a closer, more detailed focus on humanity.

verses.kjv: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.
verses.decoded: Before certain plants had fully grown, there had been no rain yet, and there was no human to cultivate the ground.
verses.context: This verse explains what was missing: rain and a worker. It sets up why God begins forming man and preparing the garden.

verses.kjv: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
verses.decoded: Instead of rain, moisture rose from the earth and watered the ground.
verses.context: This shows the earth was still being sustained. God already had provision in place even before the normal rain cycle.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
verses.decoded: The LORD God shaped man from the dust of the ground, breathed life into him, and the man became a living being.
verses.context: Humans are both physical and spiritual. The dust shows our earthly nature, and God’s breath shows that life comes directly from Him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
verses.decoded: The LORD God planted a garden in Eden and placed the man there.
verses.context: God didn’t create man and leave him in emptiness. He placed him in a prepared environment with purpose.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
verses.decoded: God caused every beautiful tree to grow, trees that were good for food, including the tree of life and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
verses.context: The garden was designed to be both beautiful and nourishing. Two specific trees are mentioned because they will become important later.

verses.kjv: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
verses.decoded: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and from there it split into four rivers.
verses.context: This shows abundance and life. Water represents provision and sustainability.

verses.kjv: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
verses.decoded: The first river was called Pison, and it flowed around the land of Havilah, where there was gold.
verses.context: The Bible includes real location details to show Eden wasn’t described as a vague idea, but as a place connected to the world.

verses.kjv: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
verses.decoded: The gold there was high quality, and the land also had valuable materials like bdellium and onyx.
verses.context: This highlights that creation began in richness and abundance. God’s original design was not scarcity.

verses.kjv: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.
verses.decoded: The second river was called Gihon, and it flowed around the land of Ethiopia.
verses.context: More geography is given to show the garden was connected to a real world.

verses.kjv: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
verses.decoded: The third river was Hiddekel, flowing east of Assyria, and the fourth river was Euphrates.
verses.context: Euphrates is a major river known in ancient history. These details anchor the story in recognizable geography.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
verses.decoded: The LORD God placed the man in the garden to work it and take care of it.
verses.context: Work existed before sin. In the beginning, work was purpose and stewardship, not punishment.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
verses.decoded: The LORD God commanded the man that he could freely eat from every tree in the garden.
verses.context: God begins with freedom and abundance. The command is not about control, but about structure and trust.

verses.kjv: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
verses.decoded: But God told him not to eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, because the day he ate from it, death would enter.
verses.context: This is the first boundary. God is protecting humanity from consequences, not withholding goodness.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.
verses.decoded: The LORD God said it was not good for the man to be alone, so He would make a suitable partner for him.
verses.context: This is the first time anything is called “not good.” Humans were designed for connection and partnership.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air, and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
verses.decoded: God formed animals and birds and brought them to Adam to see what he would name them, and whatever Adam called them became their names.
verses.context: God gives Adam a role in creation by letting him name the animals. Naming represents authority and involvement.

verses.kjv: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.
verses.decoded: Adam named all the animals and birds, but none of them were a suitable companion for him.
verses.context: This shows that nothing else in creation could fill the place of human companionship. Adam needed someone like him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
verses.decoded: The LORD God caused Adam to fall into a deep sleep, took one of his ribs, and closed the place with flesh.
verses.context: God is the one doing the work. Adam doesn’t create his partner, God provides her.

verses.kjv: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
verses.decoded: God formed a woman from the rib He took from the man and brought her to him.
verses.context: This shows intention and design. God personally presents the woman to Adam as a gift and counterpart.

verses.kjv: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.
verses.decoded: Adam recognized her immediately and said she was part of him, and he called her Woman because she came from Man.
verses.context: Adam’s first recorded words are about recognition and unity. He understands she is equal in nature, not a separate kind of being.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
verses.decoded: Because of this, a man leaves his parents, bonds to his wife, and they become one.
verses.context: This introduces the foundation of marriage: covenant, unity, and partnership.

verses.kjv: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
verses.decoded: They were both naked and felt no shame.
verses.context: This describes innocence and purity. Before sin, there was no fear, no insecurity, and no need to hide from one another.

verses.kjv: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
verses.decoded: The serpent was more crafty than any other animal God had made, and he questioned the woman, saying, “Did God really say you can’t eat from every tree in the garden?”
verses.context: The serpent starts with confusion and distortion. He doesn’t attack God directly at first, he twists God’s words to make Him seem restrictive.

verses.kjv: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
verses.decoded: The woman replied, “We are allowed to eat fruit from the trees in the garden.”
verses.context: She begins by stating the truth: God gave them permission and abundance.

verses.kjv: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
verses.decoded: “But God said we can’t eat from the tree in the middle of the garden, and we shouldn’t even touch it, or we’ll die.”
verses.context: God never said “neither shall ye touch it” in the earlier command. This shows how easily God’s words can get expanded, softened, or misquoted when temptation enters.

verses.kjv: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
verses.decoded: The serpent told her, “You won’t really die.”
verses.context: This is a direct contradiction of God. The serpent is now calling God a liar.

verses.kjv: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
verses.decoded: He said, “God knows that if you eat it, your eyes will open and you’ll be like gods, knowing good and evil.”
verses.context: This is temptation through pride. The serpent implies God is holding them back from something better.

verses.kjv: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.
verses.decoded: When the woman saw the tree looked good to eat, pleasing to look at, and desirable for gaining wisdom, she took the fruit and ate it, then gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate too.
verses.context: This verse shows how temptation works: it appeals to appetite, appearance, and ambition. Adam is not innocent here, he is present and participates.

verses.kjv: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
verses.decoded: Their eyes were opened, and they suddenly realized they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together to cover themselves.
verses.context: The first result of sin is shame. Instead of feeling freedom, they feel exposed and immediately try to cover themselves.

verses.kjv: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.
verses.decoded: They heard the LORD God in the garden during the cool of the day, and Adam and his wife hid from Him among the trees.
verses.context: Before sin, God’s presence was normal and safe. Now they hide. Sin makes people run from the very One who created them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where art thou?
verses.decoded: The LORD God called out to Adam and asked, “Where are you?”
verses.context: God already knows where Adam is. The question is not for God’s information, it’s for Adam’s confrontation and accountability.

verses.kjv: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.
verses.decoded: Adam replied, “I heard You in the garden and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid.”
verses.context: Fear enters the human experience here. Shame leads to hiding, and hiding leads to separation.

verses.kjv: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
verses.decoded: God asked, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree I commanded you not to eat from?”
verses.context: God goes straight to the issue. Sin changes awareness, identity, and relationship.

verses.kjv: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.
verses.decoded: Adam said, “The woman You gave me gave me the fruit, and I ate it.”
verses.context: This is blame-shifting. Adam blames the woman, and indirectly blames God for giving her to him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.
verses.decoded: God asked the woman what she had done, and she said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
verses.context: Eve also shifts blame. Sin not only breaks trust with God, it breaks responsibility within relationships.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
verses.decoded: God told the serpent that because of what it had done, it would be cursed above all animals, crawling on its belly and eating dust for the rest of its life.
verses.context: This is judgment. The serpent becomes a symbol of humiliation and defeat.

verses.kjv: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
verses.decoded: God said there would be conflict between the serpent and the woman, and between their offspring. The woman’s seed would crush the serpent’s head, while the serpent would bruise his heel.
verses.context: This is one of the most important verses in Genesis. It’s the first promise that evil will not win forever, and that a future Savior would come.

verses.kjv: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
verses.decoded: God told the woman that childbirth would now involve increased pain, and that tension would enter the relationship between her and her husband, with imbalance in leadership.
verses.context: This shows the impact of sin on the body and relationships. It describes the brokenness that enters, not necessarily God’s ideal design.

verses.kjv: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
verses.decoded: God told Adam that because he listened and disobeyed, the ground would now be cursed, and he would struggle to produce food from it all his life.
verses.context: Sin affects work. What was once joyful stewardship becomes painful struggle and survival.

verses.kjv: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
verses.decoded: The ground would produce thorns and thistles, and Adam would have to work hard to eat from it.
verses.context: This introduces resistance into creation. The earth no longer responds effortlessly.

verses.kjv: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
verses.decoded: Adam would eat by hard labor for the rest of his life until he died and returned to the ground, because he came from dust and would return to dust.
verses.context: This introduces physical death as part of humanity’s broken condition. It is one of the most sobering consequences of sin.

verses.kjv: And Adam called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.
verses.decoded: Adam named his wife Eve because she would become the mother of all living people.
verses.context: Even after sin and judgment, life continues. This is a small but powerful sign of hope.

verses.kjv: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.
verses.decoded: The LORD God made clothing from animal skins for Adam and his wife, and He clothed them.
verses.context: This is the first covering God provides. It shows mercy, and it hints at sacrifice, because something had to die for them to be covered.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:
verses.decoded: The LORD God said that man had now become like them in knowing good and evil, and He prevented him from taking from the tree of life and living forever in that fallen state.
verses.context: This is not God being cruel. It is protection. Living forever in sin would mean eternal brokenness with no restoration.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
verses.decoded: So the LORD God sent him out of the Garden of Eden to work the ground he came from.
verses.context: Leaving Eden represents separation from perfect provision. Life becomes harder, but God is still involved.

verses.kjv: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
verses.decoded: God drove the man out and placed cherubim and a flaming sword at the entrance of Eden to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.context: This shows Eden was closed off. Humanity could not return to perfection through their own effort. Restoration would require God’s future plan.

verses.kjv: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.
verses.decoded: Adam and Eve became husband and wife in intimacy, and Eve became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “I have received a man from the LORD.”
verses.context: “Knew” is biblical language for intimacy. Eve recognizes that life is a gift from God, even after the fall.

verses.kjv: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
verses.decoded: Eve later gave birth to Abel. Abel became a shepherd, and Cain became a farmer.
verses.context: Both roles are valuable. This sets up the difference in what each brother will bring to God.

verses.kjv: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.
verses.decoded: After some time passed, Cain brought an offering to the LORD from what he grew from the ground.
verses.context: Cain does give something. The issue is not that he brought nothing, but what kind of offering it was.

verses.kjv: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:
verses.decoded: Abel also brought an offering, but he brought the firstborn of his flock and the best portions. And the LORD accepted Abel and his offering.
verses.context: Abel gave God his first and his best. The verse highlights quality and honor, not just the act of giving.

verses.kjv: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
verses.decoded: But God did not accept Cain and his offering. Cain became furious, and his face showed it.
verses.context: Cain’s response reveals what was inside him. Instead of reflecting and correcting, he becomes angry.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
verses.decoded: The LORD asked Cain, “Why are you angry, and why do you look so down?”
verses.context: God doesn’t immediately punish Cain. He confronts him with questions, giving him a chance to change direction.

verses.kjv: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.
verses.decoded: God told Cain, “If you do what is right, you will be accepted. But if you don’t, sin is waiting at the door. It wants to control you, but you must rule over it.”
verses.context: This verse shows that sin is not passive. It crouches like a predator, waiting for an opening. God warns Cain that he still has a choice.

verses.kjv: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
verses.decoded: Cain spoke with Abel, and later, while they were in the field, Cain attacked his brother and killed him.
verses.context: This is the first murder in the Bible. Sin moves quickly from anger to violence when it is not mastered.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother's keeper?
verses.decoded: The LORD asked Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” Cain replied, “I don’t know. Am I supposed to be responsible for him?”
verses.context: Cain lies to God and speaks with disrespect. The question “Am I my brother’s keeper?” shows how sin destroys responsibility and love.

verses.kjv: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.
verses.decoded: God said, “What have you done? Your brother’s blood is crying out to me from the ground.”
verses.context: God makes it clear that nothing is hidden. Innocent blood demands justice.

verses.kjv: And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
verses.decoded: God told Cain that he was now cursed from the earth, which had received his brother’s blood from his hand.
verses.context: Cain’s punishment connects directly to what he did. The ground, which Cain worked, becomes tied to his judgment.

verses.kjv: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
verses.decoded: God told Cain that the ground would no longer produce well for him, and he would become a wanderer on the earth.
verses.context: Cain’s identity as a farmer is now broken. His punishment is instability and displacement.

verses.kjv: And Cain said unto the LORD, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
verses.decoded: Cain said to the LORD, “This punishment is more than I can handle.”
verses.context: Cain expresses regret, but it is more about consequences than repentance.

verses.kjv: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.
verses.decoded: Cain said, “You are driving me away from the land, away from Your presence. I’ll be a wanderer, and anyone who finds me will kill me.”
verses.context: Cain fears revenge. He understands that violence creates a cycle, and he expects to become a victim of what he started.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
verses.decoded: The LORD said that anyone who killed Cain would be punished severely, and God placed a mark on Cain to protect him from being killed.
verses.context: This is mercy in the middle of judgment. Cain deserved death, but God protects him from immediate revenge.

verses.kjv: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
verses.decoded: Cain left the presence of the LORD and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.context: This is one of the saddest lines in Genesis. Cain is physically alive, but spiritually separated.

verses.kjv: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
verses.decoded: Cain became intimate with his wife, she became pregnant, and she gave birth to Enoch. Cain built a city and named it after his son.
verses.context: Even in separation from God, Cain builds legacy. This shows how humans can build civilization while still being spiritually lost.

verses.kjv: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.
verses.decoded: Enoch had a son named Irad, Irad had Mehujael, Mehujael had Methusael, and Methusael had Lamech.
verses.context: This genealogy shows the continuation of Cain’s line. The story is moving toward how sin spreads through generations.

verses.kjv: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
verses.decoded: Lamech took two wives, one named Adah and the other named Zillah.
verses.context: This is the first mention of polygamy in the Bible. It shows the distortion of God’s original design from Genesis 2.

verses.kjv: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.
verses.decoded: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who became the father of people who live in tents and raise livestock.
verses.context: This highlights the growth of culture and civilization: farming, herding, and community life.

verses.kjv: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
verses.decoded: His brother was Jubal, who became the father of people who create music using instruments.
verses.context: Even in a fallen world, creativity still exists. Music becomes part of human culture early on.

verses.kjv: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.
verses.decoded: Zillah gave birth to Tubalcain, who became skilled in working with metal like bronze and iron. His sister was Naamah.
verses.context: This introduces craftsmanship and technology. Human ability grows, even while sin continues.

verses.kjv: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.
verses.decoded: Lamech told his wives to listen to him, saying he killed a man for hurting him and a young man for wounding him.
verses.context: This is violence without remorse. Unlike Cain, who feared consequences, Lamech boasts about killing.

verses.kjv: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
verses.decoded: Lamech said, “If Cain is avenged seven times, then I will be avenged seventy-seven times.”
verses.context: Sin escalates. Cain killed once and feared punishment, but Lamech kills and brags, claiming even greater protection.

verses.kjv: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.
verses.decoded: Adam and Eve had another son, and Eve named him Seth because she said God appointed her another child to replace Abel, whom Cain killed.
verses.context: This is restoration after tragedy. God continues the promise through a new line.

verses.kjv: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.
verses.decoded: Seth also had a son named Enos, and during that time people began calling on the name of the LORD.
verses.context: Even as sin spreads, worship begins to rise. This verse introduces the beginning of public devotion and dependence on God.

verses.kjv: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;
verses.decoded: This section records the lineage of Adam, beginning with humanity’s creation as reflecting divine likeness.

verses.kjv: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
verses.decoded: Humanity is described collectively as male and female and identified together under the name Adam at creation.

verses.kjv: And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:
verses.decoded: After 130 years, Adam had a son named Seth, described as reflecting Adam’s own likeness.

verses.kjv: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Adam lived many additional years and had other children.

verses.kjv: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Adam lived a total of 930 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:
verses.decoded: Seth lived 105 years before having a son named Enos.

verses.kjv: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Seth lived many more years and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Seth lived 912 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:
verses.decoded: Enos lived 90 years before having a son named Cainan.

verses.kjv: And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Enos lived many more years and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Enos lived 905 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalaleel:
verses.decoded: Cainan lived 70 years before having a son named Mahalaleel.

verses.kjv: And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Cainan lived many additional years and had other children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Cainan lived 910 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:
verses.decoded: Mahalaleel lived 65 years before having a son named Jared.

verses.kjv: And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Mahalaleel lived many more years and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Mahalaleel lived 895 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:
verses.decoded: Jared lived 162 years before having a son named Enoch.

verses.kjv: And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Jared lived many additional years and had other children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Jared lived 962 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:
verses.decoded: Enoch lived 65 years before having a son named Methuselah.

verses.kjv: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Enoch is described as living in close alignment with divine guidance and had other children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
verses.decoded: Enoch lived a total of 365 years.

verses.kjv: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
verses.decoded: Enoch’s life ends differently from others, described as being taken rather than dying.

verses.kjv: And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:
verses.decoded: Methuselah lived 187 years before having a son named Lamech.

verses.kjv: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Methuselah lived many more years and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Methuselah lived 969 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:
verses.decoded: Lamech lived 182 years before having a son.

verses.kjv: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands…
verses.decoded: The child is named Noah, with hope that he will bring relief from hardship and labor.

verses.kjv: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
verses.decoded: Lamech lived many additional years and had other children.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Lamech lived 777 years and then died.

verses.kjv: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.decoded: At 500 years old, Noah becomes the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

chapters.title: Human Corruption and the Decision to Preserve

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
verses.decoded: As the human population increased, families continued to grow and expand.

verses.kjv: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
verses.decoded: Certain figures described as “sons of God” took women as partners based on attraction and choice.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
verses.decoded: Human life is described as limited, and a boundary is placed on its duration.

verses.kjv: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that…
verses.decoded: The text refers to powerful or notable figures known for strength or reputation during that time.

verses.kjv: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth…
verses.decoded: Human behavior is described as increasingly harmful and destructive.

verses.kjv: And it repented the Lord that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
verses.decoded: The situation is described using human emotion to convey deep regret over the state of humanity.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth…
verses.decoded: A decision is described to remove what has become destructive within creation.

verses.kjv: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the Lord.
verses.decoded: Noah is presented as receiving favor.

verses.kjv: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
verses.decoded: Noah is described as upright within his community and aligned with divine guidance.

verses.kjv: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.decoded: Noah has three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.kjv: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
verses.decoded: Human society is described as morally broken and marked by widespread violence.

verses.kjv: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
verses.decoded: The breakdown of order is described as affecting all of humanity.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me…
verses.decoded: Noah is informed that destruction is coming because of widespread violence.

verses.kjv: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark…
verses.decoded: Noah is instructed to build a large vessel designed for preservation.

verses.kjv: And this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of…
verses.decoded: Specific dimensions for the structure are given.

verses.kjv: A window shalt thou make to the ark…
verses.decoded: Instructions include ventilation, multiple levels, and a single entry.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth…
verses.decoded: A flood is described as the means of destruction.

verses.kjv: But with thee will I establish my covenant…
verses.decoded: Noah and his family are designated for preservation through an agreement.

verses.kjv: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark…
verses.decoded: Living creatures are to be preserved to continue life after the flood.

verses.kjv: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind…
verses.decoded: Animals are organized by type for preservation.

verses.kjv: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten…
verses.decoded: Provisioning is required for survival during the flood.

verses.kjv: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
verses.decoded: Noah follows the instructions given to him.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
verses.decoded: Noah and his family are instructed to enter the ark because Noah is viewed as upright within his time.

verses.kjv: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.
verses.decoded: Noah is instructed to bring multiple pairs of animals, with distinctions made between categories described as clean and unclean.

verses.kjv: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
verses.decoded: Birds are also to be preserved in multiple pairs so life can continue afterward.

verses.kjv: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights…
verses.decoded: A specific period of time is given before heavy rain begins, which will remove existing life from the land.

verses.kjv: And Noah did according unto all that the Lord commanded him.
verses.decoded: Noah follows all the instructions given to him.

verses.kjv: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
verses.decoded: Noah is identified as 600 years old at the time the flood begins.

verses.kjv: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
verses.decoded: Noah and his immediate family enter the ark in preparation for the flood.

verses.kjv: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,
verses.decoded: Animals of all categories are brought together as instructed.

verses.kjv: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.
verses.decoded: Pairs of animals enter the ark according to the instructions given.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
verses.decoded: After the waiting period, the floodwaters begin.

verses.kjv: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life… were all the fountains of the great deep broken up…
verses.decoded: The flood is described as coming from both below the earth and from heavy rainfall above.

verses.kjv: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.decoded: Rain continues for an extended, defined period of time.

verses.kjv: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth…
verses.decoded: Noah and his family enter the ark together on the same day.

verses.kjv: They, and every beast after his kind…
verses.decoded: Animals of every category enter the ark as planned.

verses.kjv: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh…
verses.decoded: All living creatures capable of life enter the ark in pairs.

verses.kjv: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh…
verses.decoded: The ark is sealed once all living beings are inside.

verses.kjv: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased…
verses.decoded: Floodwaters continue to rise and lift the ark from the ground.

verses.kjv: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth…
verses.decoded: The floodwaters dominate the landscape, carrying the ark across the surface.

verses.kjv: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills…
verses.decoded: Floodwaters cover even the highest landforms.

verses.kjv: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
verses.decoded: The depth of the flood is described as exceeding the height of the mountains.

verses.kjv: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth…
verses.decoded: All living creatures outside the ark perish in the flood.

verses.kjv: All in whose nostrils was the breath of life…
verses.decoded: All land-based life is described as being lost.

verses.kjv: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground…
verses.decoded: Only Noah and those with him in the ark remain alive.

verses.kjv: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
verses.decoded: The floodwaters remain dominant over the earth for an extended period.

verses.kjv: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;
verses.decoded: Attention returns to Noah and all living beings with him, and conditions begin to change as the waters start to recede.

verses.kjv: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
verses.decoded: The sources of flooding are described as being shut off, and rainfall stops.

verses.kjv: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
verses.decoded: The floodwaters steadily withdraw after the stated period.

verses.kjv: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
verses.decoded: The ark comes to rest on a mountainous region identified as Ararat on a specific date.

verses.kjv: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
verses.decoded: As waters continue to recede, mountain peaks become visible.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
verses.decoded: After a waiting period, Noah opens an opening in the ark.

verses.kjv: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
verses.decoded: A raven is released and continues flying back and forth while the ground remains wet.

verses.kjv: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
verses.decoded: A dove is sent out to determine whether the land has dried.

verses.kjv: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark…
verses.decoded: The dove finds no suitable place to land and returns to the ark.

verses.kjv: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
verses.decoded: After waiting another week, Noah sends the dove out again.

verses.kjv: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf pluckt off…
verses.decoded: The dove returns carrying a freshly picked olive leaf, signaling that plant life has reemerged.

verses.kjv: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.
verses.decoded: After another week, the dove is sent out and does not return, indicating the land is habitable.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year… the waters were dried up from off the earth…
verses.decoded: By this time, the surface of the earth is dry, and Noah removes part of the ark to observe conditions.

verses.kjv: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
verses.decoded: The earth is fully dry on a specific recorded date.

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Noah, saying,
verses.decoded: Noah receives further instruction.

verses.kjv: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
verses.decoded: Noah and his family are instructed to leave the ark.

verses.kjv: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee…
verses.decoded: All living creatures are to exit the ark so life can repopulate the earth.

verses.kjv: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:
verses.decoded: Noah and his family leave the ark.

verses.kjv: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl… went forth out of the ark.
verses.decoded: All animals exit the ark according to their kinds.

verses.kjv: And Noah builded an altar unto the Lord…
verses.decoded: Noah constructs an altar and presents offerings.

verses.kjv: And the Lord smelled a sweet savour; and the Lord said in his heart…
verses.decoded: A commitment is expressed that the earth will not again be destroyed in this manner, despite human imperfection.

verses.kjv: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest… shall not cease.
verses.decoded: The ongoing cycles of nature are described as continuing consistently.

verses.kjv: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
verses.decoded: Noah and his sons are encouraged to grow their families and repopulate the earth.

verses.kjv: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth…
verses.decoded: Animals are described as becoming wary of humans, and human authority over other creatures is established.

verses.kjv: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you…
verses.decoded: Humans are permitted to eat animal life in addition to plants.

verses.kjv: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
verses.decoded: A restriction is placed against consuming blood, which represents life.

verses.kjv: And surely your blood of your lives will I require…
verses.decoded: Human life is described as accountable, and violence against humans carries consequences.

verses.kjv: Whoso sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed…
verses.decoded: Human life is described as uniquely valuable, with serious consequences for taking it.

verses.kjv: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
verses.decoded: The command to grow and repopulate the earth is repeated.

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
verses.decoded: A new declaration is introduced.

verses.kjv: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
verses.decoded: An agreement is described between the divine and Noah’s descendants.

verses.kjv: And with every living creature that is with you…
verses.decoded: The agreement is said to include all living creatures.

verses.kjv: And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood…
verses.decoded: A promise is made that a flood of this kind will not again destroy all life.

verses.kjv: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you…
verses.decoded: A visible sign is introduced to represent this agreement.

verses.kjv: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant…
verses.decoded: The rainbow is presented as the sign of this agreement.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth…
verses.decoded: The rainbow will appear when clouds gather.

verses.kjv: And I will remember my covenant…
verses.decoded: The agreement is reaffirmed whenever the sign appears.

verses.kjv: And the bow shall be in the cloud…
verses.decoded: The rainbow serves as a reminder of the promise not to destroy life by flood again.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant…
verses.decoded: The covenant sign is restated for clarity.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Noah, that went forth of the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth…
verses.decoded: Noah’s sons are identified as the ancestors of future populations.

verses.kjv: These are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.
verses.decoded: Human populations are described as spreading from Noah’s sons.

verses.kjv: And Noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
verses.decoded: Noah turns to agriculture and plants a vineyard.

verses.kjv: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
verses.decoded: Noah becomes intoxicated and is left exposed.

verses.kjv: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father…
verses.decoded: Ham observes Noah’s condition and tells his brothers.

verses.kjv: And Shem and Japheth took a garment…
verses.decoded: Shem and Japheth act to preserve Noah’s dignity without looking at him.

verses.kjv: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
verses.decoded: Noah becomes aware of what occurred while he was intoxicated.

verses.kjv: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
verses.decoded: A declaration is spoken concerning Canaan’s future status.

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be the Lord God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
verses.decoded: Shem’s lineage is associated with favor, while Canaan’s is described as subordinate.

verses.kjv: God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem…
verses.decoded: Japheth’s descendants are described as expanding and sharing space with Shem’s lineage.

verses.kjv: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
verses.decoded: Noah lives for many years after the flood.

verses.kjv: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
verses.decoded: Noah lives a total of 950 years and then dies.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
verses.decoded: This chapter records the descendants of Noah’s sons—Shem, Ham, and Japheth—born after the flood.

verses.kjv: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.decoded: Japheth’s sons are listed as Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.decoded: Gomer’s sons are Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
verses.decoded: Javan’s sons are Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

verses.kjv: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
verses.decoded: These descendants spread out into different regions, forming distinct languages, families, and nations.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.
verses.decoded: Ham’s sons are Cush, Mizraim, Phut, and Canaan.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtecha…
verses.decoded: Cush’s sons are listed, including Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabtecha, along with Raamah’s sons Sheba and Dedan.

verses.kjv: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
verses.decoded: Cush becomes the father of Nimrod, who is described as a powerful figure on the earth.

verses.kjv: He was a mighty hunter before the Lord…
verses.decoded: Nimrod is known for strength and dominance, becoming a well-known figure.

verses.kjv: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh…
verses.decoded: Nimrod’s rule begins in several cities located in the region of Shinar.

verses.kjv: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh…
verses.decoded: From that region, settlements expand and cities such as Nineveh are established.

verses.kjv: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.
verses.decoded: Resen is identified as a major city located between other established centers.

verses.kjv: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
verses.decoded: Mizraim’s descendants are listed as several groups.

verses.kjv: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim… and Caphtorim.
verses.decoded: Additional descendant groups are named, including the origin of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And Canaan begat Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
verses.decoded: Canaan’s sons include Sidon and Heth.

verses.kjv: And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,
verses.decoded: Various groups descending from Canaan are listed.

verses.kjv: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
verses.decoded: Additional Canaanite groups are named.

verses.kjv: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite…
verses.decoded: More family groups are identified, showing expansion over time.

verses.kjv: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon…
verses.decoded: Geographic boundaries of Canaanite territory are described.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
verses.decoded: Ham’s descendants form distinct families, languages, lands, and nations.

verses.kjv: Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber…
verses.decoded: Shem is introduced as an ancestor of Eber and related peoples.

verses.kjv: The children of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
verses.decoded: Shem’s sons are Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.

verses.kjv: And the children of Aram; Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
verses.decoded: Aram’s sons are listed.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad begat Salah; and Salah begat Eber.
verses.decoded: A direct lineage is traced through Arphaxad, Salah, and Eber.

verses.kjv: And unto Eber were born two sons…
verses.decoded: Eber’s sons are named Peleg and Joktan, with Peleg associated with a time of division.

verses.kjv: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
verses.decoded: Joktan’s sons are listed.

verses.kjv: And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
verses.decoded: Additional sons of Joktan are named.

verses.kjv: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
verses.decoded: More descendants of Joktan are recorded.

verses.kjv: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab…
verses.decoded: The final sons of Joktan are listed.

verses.kjv: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar…
verses.decoded: The geographic area where Joktan’s descendants settled is described.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
verses.decoded: Shem’s descendants are summarized as forming distinct families, languages, lands, and nations.

verses.kjv: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations…
verses.decoded: All nations are described as descending from Noah’s family after the flood. Genesis 11 — The Tower of Babel & the Line of Shem

verses.kjv: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
verses.decoded: At this time, everyone on earth spoke the same language and communicated the same way.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
verses.decoded: As people migrated eastward, they discovered a large flat land called Shinar and decided to settle there.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them throughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.
verses.decoded: They worked together to make strong bricks and used tar instead of mortar, showing early human innovation and cooperation.

verses.kjv: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
verses.decoded: They planned to build a powerful city and a massive tower to gain recognition and prevent themselves from being spread across the earth.

verses.kjv: And the Lord came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
verses.decoded: God observed what humanity was building and took notice of their intentions.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
verses.decoded: God recognized that human unity and shared language gave them great power to accomplish whatever they set their minds to.

verses.kjv: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
verses.decoded: God decided to confuse their language so they could no longer easily understand each other.

verses.kjv: So the Lord scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
verses.decoded: As communication broke down, people spread out across the earth and abandoned the construction of the city.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the Lord did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the Lord scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
verses.decoded: The city was named Babel because it symbolized confusion, marking the moment languages were divided and humanity dispersed worldwide. The Family Line of Shem Begins

verses.kjv: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:
verses.decoded: This section begins tracing the family line of Shem, starting two years after the flood with his son Arphaxad.

verses.kjv: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: Shem lived many years after Arphaxad was born and had other children as well.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:
verses.decoded: Arphaxad was 35 years old when he became the father of Salah.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: After Salah was born, Arphaxad lived another 403 years and had more children.

verses.kjv: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
verses.decoded: Salah was 30 years old when he became the father of Eber.

verses.kjv: And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: After Eber’s birth, Salah lived another 403 years and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
verses.decoded: Eber was 34 years old when he became the father of Peleg.

verses.kjv: And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: Eber lived another 430 years after Peleg’s birth and had more children.

verses.kjv: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
verses.decoded: Peleg was 30 years old when he became the father of Reu.

verses.kjv: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: After Reu was born, Peleg lived another 209 years and had more children.

verses.kjv: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
verses.decoded: Reu was 32 years old when he became the father of Serug.

verses.kjv: And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: Reu lived another 207 years after Serug’s birth and had additional children.

verses.kjv: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
verses.decoded: Serug was 30 years old when he became the father of Nahor.

verses.kjv: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: After Nahor was born, Serug lived another 200 years and had more children.

verses.kjv: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
verses.decoded: Nahor was 29 years old when he became the father of Terah.

verses.kjv: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.decoded: Nahor lived another 119 years after Terah’s birth and had more children.

verses.kjv: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verses.decoded: Terah became a father at age 70 and had three sons: Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
verses.decoded: This section focuses on Terah’s family line, including his sons and his grandson Lot.

verses.kjv: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
verses.decoded: Haran died while his father Terah was still alive, in his hometown of Ur.

verses.kjv: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
verses.decoded: Abram married Sarai, and Nahor married Milcah, who was Haran’s daughter.

verses.kjv: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.
verses.decoded: Sarai was unable to have children.

verses.kjv: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
verses.decoded: Terah led his family out of Ur toward Canaan, but they stopped and settled in Haran instead.

verses.kjv: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
verses.decoded: Terah lived 205 years and died in Haran. Genesis 12 — The Call of Abram

verses.kjv: Now the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:
verses.decoded: God told Abram to leave his homeland, his relatives, and his father’s household and go to a land God would reveal to him later.

verses.kjv: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
verses.decoded: God promised to turn Abram into a great nation, bless him, make his name well known, and use him as a blessing to others.

verses.kjv: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
verses.decoded: God said He would favor those who supported Abram, oppose those who harmed him, and bless all people on earth through him.

verses.kjv: So Abram departed, as the Lord had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
verses.decoded: Abram obeyed God, leaving Haran at seventy-five years old, and his nephew Lot went with him.

verses.kjv: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
verses.decoded: Abram left with his wife Sarai, his nephew Lot, their possessions, and the people connected to their household, and they entered the land of Canaan.

verses.kjv: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
verses.decoded: Abram traveled through Canaan to Shechem, even though other people were already living there.

verses.kjv: And the Lord appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the Lord, who appeared unto him.
verses.decoded: God appeared to Abram and promised that his descendants would one day inherit the land, so Abram built an altar to honor God.

verses.kjv: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the Lord, and called upon the name of the Lord.
verses.decoded: Abram moved again, set up his tent between Bethel and Ai, built another altar, and worshiped God there.

verses.kjv: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.
verses.decoded: Abram continued traveling south, following God’s direction step by step.

verses.kjv: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.
verses.decoded: A severe famine struck the land, so Abram went to Egypt temporarily to survive.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
verses.decoded: As they approached Egypt, Abram acknowledged how beautiful Sarai was.

verses.kjv: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
verses.decoded: Abram feared the Egyptians would kill him so they could take Sarai.

verses.kjv: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
verses.decoded: Abram asked Sarai to say she was his sister so his life would be spared.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
verses.decoded: When they arrived, the Egyptians immediately noticed Sarai’s beauty.

verses.kjv: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh’s officials praised Sarai to him, and she was brought into Pharaoh’s household.

verses.kjv: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.
