verses.decoded: Because of Sarai, Pharaoh treated Abram generously and gave him wealth, livestock, and servants.

verses.kjv: And the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram’s wife.
verses.decoded: God brought serious trouble upon Pharaoh’s household because Sarai was actually Abram’s wife.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
verses.decoded: Pharaoh confronted Abram and questioned why he had hidden the truth.

verses.kjv: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh explained that Abram’s lie nearly caused him to sin and ordered Abram to take Sarai and leave.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh had Abram, Sarai, and everything they owned escorted out of Egypt. Genesis 13 — Abram and Lot Separate

verses.kjv: And Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.
verses.decoded: Abram left Egypt with his wife, his possessions, and Lot, traveling back toward the southern region.

verses.kjv: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
verses.decoded: Abram had become extremely wealthy, owning livestock and large amounts of silver and gold.

verses.kjv: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai;
verses.decoded: Abram retraced his steps back to where he had first set up his tent between Bethel and Ai.

verses.kjv: Unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the Lord.
verses.decoded: Abram returned to the altar he had built earlier and worshiped God there again.

verses.kjv: And Lot also, which went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
verses.decoded: Lot also had livestock and possessions of his own.

verses.kjv: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
verses.decoded: The land could not support both Abram’s and Lot’s growing wealth, so they could no longer live close together.

verses.kjv: And there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram’s cattle and the herdmen of Lot’s cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.
verses.decoded: Conflict broke out between their herdsmen, while other people groups already lived in the land.

verses.kjv: And Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we be brethren.
verses.decoded: Abram asked Lot to avoid conflict, reminding him that they were family.

verses.kjv: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.
verses.decoded: Abram offered Lot first choice of the land, promising to go in the opposite direction.

verses.kjv: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.
verses.decoded: Lot looked over the Jordan Valley and saw that it was lush and fertile, like God’s garden or the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.
verses.decoded: Lot chose the fertile valley and moved east, separating himself from Abram.

verses.kjv: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward Sodom.
verses.decoded: Abram stayed in Canaan, while Lot settled near the city of Sodom.

verses.kjv: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the Lord exceedingly.
verses.decoded: The people of Sodom were extremely corrupt and sinful in God’s sight.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:
verses.decoded: After Lot left, God told Abram to look in every direction around him.

verses.kjv: For all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.
verses.decoded: God promised to give all the land Abram saw to him and his descendants forever.

verses.kjv: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.
verses.decoded: God said Abram’s descendants would be too numerous to count.

verses.kjv: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.
verses.decoded: God instructed Abram to walk through the land as a sign that it would one day belong to him.

verses.kjv: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the Lord.
verses.decoded: Abram moved his camp to Hebron and built another altar to honor God. Genesis 14 — Abram Rescues Lot

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations;
verses.decoded: During this time, four powerful kings ruled different regions and formed an alliance.

verses.kjv: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.
verses.decoded: These four kings went to war against five other kings, including the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.kjv: All these were joined together in the vale of Siddim, which is the salt sea.
verses.decoded: All the opposing forces gathered together in the Valley of Siddim, near what later became the Dead Sea.

verses.kjv: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.decoded: For twelve years the smaller kingdoms were under Chedorlaomer’s control, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

verses.kjv: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
verses.decoded: Chedorlaomer and his allies attacked and defeated several powerful people groups in different regions.

verses.kjv: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto Elparan, which is by the wilderness.
verses.decoded: They also defeated the Horites living in the hill country of Seir, near the desert.

verses.kjv: And they returned, and came to Enmishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazezontamar.
verses.decoded: On their return, they attacked and defeated the Amalekites and the Amorites living in that region.

verses.kjv: And there went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar); and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim;
verses.decoded: The five local kings went out to fight the four invading kings in the Valley of Siddim.

verses.kjv: With Chedorlaomer the king of Elam, and with Tidal king of nations, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings with five.
verses.decoded: The battle was between four powerful kings and five regional kings.

verses.kjv: And the vale of Siddim was full of slimepits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and fell there; and they that remained fled to the mountain.
verses.decoded: The valley was filled with tar pits, and as the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, some fell into them while others escaped to the mountains.

verses.kjv: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way.
verses.decoded: The invading kings seized all the possessions and food from Sodom and Gomorrah and left.

verses.kjv: And they took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
verses.decoded: Lot, Abram’s nephew who lived in Sodom, was captured along with all his belongings.

verses.kjv: And there came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew; for he dwelt in the plain of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner: and these were confederate with Abram.
verses.decoded: A survivor escaped and told Abram what had happened; Abram was living near Mamre and was allied with local leaders.

verses.kjv: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.
verses.decoded: When Abram heard Lot was captured, he gathered 318 trained men from his household and chased the enemy.

verses.kjv: And he divided himself against them, he and his servants, by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
verses.decoded: Abram attacked them at night, defeated them, and chased them as far as Hobah near Damascus.

verses.kjv: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.
verses.decoded: Abram recovered all the stolen goods and rescued Lot, the women, and the other captives.

verses.kjv: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer, and of the kings that were with him, at the valley of Shaveh, which is the king’s dale.
verses.decoded: After the victory, the king of Sodom went out to meet Abram in the King’s Valley.

verses.kjv: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God.
verses.decoded: Melchizedek, the king of Salem and priest of the Most High God, brought Abram bread and wine.

verses.kjv: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:
verses.decoded: Melchizedek blessed Abram, acknowledging that his blessing came from the God who owns everything.

verses.kjv: And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all.
verses.decoded: Melchizedek praised God for Abram’s victory, and Abram gave him a tenth of everything.

verses.kjv: And the king of Sodom said unto Abram, Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.
verses.decoded: The king of Sodom offered Abram the possessions if he would return the people.

verses.kjv: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lift up mine hand unto the Lord, the most high God, the possessor of heaven and earth,
verses.decoded: Abram told the king that he had made a promise to God.

verses.kjv: That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:
verses.decoded: Abram refused to take any reward so no one could claim they made him wealthy.

verses.kjv: Save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.
verses.decoded: Abram only allowed his allies to receive their share for helping in the battle. Genesis 15 — God’s Covenant With Abram

verses.kjv: After these things the word of the Lord came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
verses.decoded: After everything that had happened, God spoke to Abram in a vision and told him not to be afraid, promising to protect him and reward him greatly.

verses.kjv: And Abram said, Lord God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
verses.decoded: Abram asked God what reward he could receive if he had no children and his servant would inherit everything.

verses.kjv: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.
verses.decoded: Abram pointed out that since he had no child, someone from his household would become his heir.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the word of the Lord came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.
verses.decoded: God told Abram that his heir would be his own biological son.

verses.kjv: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
verses.decoded: God brought Abram outside and told him to look at the stars, explaining that his descendants would be just as countless.

verses.kjv: And he believed in the Lord; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
verses.decoded: Abram trusted God completely, and God accepted that faith as righteousness.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, I am the Lord that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
verses.decoded: God reminded Abram that He had brought him out of Ur in order to give him this land.

verses.kjv: And he said, Lord God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
verses.decoded: Abram asked how he could be sure that he would receive the land.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.
verses.decoded: God instructed Abram to bring specific animals as part of a covenant ritual.

verses.kjv: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
verses.decoded: Abram prepared the animals exactly as instructed, cutting them in half except for the birds.

verses.kjv: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
verses.decoded: When birds tried to land on the carcasses, Abram chased them away.

verses.kjv: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.
verses.decoded: As night fell, Abram entered a deep sleep and experienced overwhelming fear and darkness.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
verses.decoded: God told Abram that his descendants would live as strangers in another land, be enslaved, and suffer for four hundred years.

verses.kjv: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
verses.decoded: God promised to judge that nation and later bring Abram’s descendants out with great wealth.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
verses.decoded: God assured Abram that he would live a long life and die peacefully.

verses.kjv: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
verses.decoded: God explained that Abram’s descendants would return to this land later, once the current inhabitants had fully corrupted themselves.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.
verses.decoded: As darkness fell, Abram saw a smoking firepot and a blazing torch pass between the animal pieces.

verses.kjv: In the same day the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
verses.decoded: That day, God made a covenant promising Abram’s descendants a vast stretch of land.

verses.kjv: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,
verses.decoded: God listed the first group of peoples whose land would eventually be given to Abram’s descendants.

verses.kjv: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,
verses.decoded: More people groups living in the land were named.

verses.kjv: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
verses.decoded: God completed the list of nations whose land would one day belong to Abram’s descendants. Genesis 16 — Hagar and Ishmael

verses.kjv: Now Sarai Abram’s wife bare him no children: and she had an handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
verses.decoded: Sarai had not been able to have children, and she had an Egyptian servant named Hagar.

verses.kjv: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the Lord hath restrained me from bearing: I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
verses.decoded: Sarai suggested that Abram have a child through her servant Hagar, hoping to build a family that way, and Abram agreed.

verses.kjv: And Sarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.
verses.decoded: After Abram had lived in Canaan for ten years, Sarai gave Hagar to him as a wife.

verses.kjv: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
verses.decoded: Hagar became pregnant, and once she knew it, she looked down on Sarai.

verses.kjv: And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee: I have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: the Lord judge between me and thee.
verses.decoded: Sarai blamed Abram for the situation, feeling disrespected by Hagar and asking God to judge between them.

verses.kjv: But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. And when Sarai dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face.
verses.decoded: Abram told Sarai to handle the situation herself, and Sarai treated Hagar harshly, causing Hagar to run away.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.
verses.decoded: An angel of the Lord found Hagar by a spring of water in the desert on the road to Shur.

verses.kjv: And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.
verses.decoded: The angel asked Hagar where she had come from and where she was going, and she explained that she was running away from Sarai.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands.
verses.decoded: The angel told Hagar to return to Sarai and submit to her authority.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
verses.decoded: The angel promised that Hagar’s descendants would be too many to count.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the Lord hath heard thy affliction.
verses.decoded: The angel told Hagar she would have a son named Ishmael, meaning God had heard her suffering.

verses.kjv: And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man’s hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.
verses.decoded: Ishmael would grow up strong and independent, often in conflict, yet living among his relatives.

verses.kjv: And she called the name of the Lord that spake unto her, Thou God seest me: for she said, Have I also here looked after him that seeth me?
verses.decoded: Hagar called God “the God who sees me,” realizing that God had noticed her pain.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the well was called Beerlahairoi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.decoded: The well was named Beer-lahai-roi to mark the place where God saw and spoke to Hagar.

verses.kjv: And Hagar bare Abram a son: and Abram called his son’s name, which Hagar bare, Ishmael.
verses.decoded: Hagar gave birth to a son, and Abram named him Ishmael.

verses.kjv: And Abram was fourscore and six years old, when Hagar bare Ishmael to Abram.
verses.decoded: Abram was eighty-six years old when Ishmael was born. Genesis 17 — God Renames Abram and Establishes Circumcision

verses.kjv: And when Abram was ninety years old and nine, the Lord appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am the Almighty God; walk before me, and be thou perfect.
verses.decoded: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, God appeared to him and called him to live faithfully and uprightly before Him.

verses.kjv: And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
verses.decoded: God promised to establish a covenant with Abram and greatly increase his descendants.

verses.kjv: And Abram fell on his face: and God talked with him, saying,
verses.decoded: Abram bowed down in reverence as God spoke to him.

verses.kjv: As for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations.
verses.decoded: God declared that Abram would become the father of many nations.

verses.kjv: Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for a father of many nations have I made thee.
verses.decoded: God changed Abram’s name to Abraham, reflecting his future role as the father of many nations.

verses.kjv: And I will make thee exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.
verses.decoded: God promised that Abraham’s family line would be fruitful and include nations and kings.

verses.kjv: And I will establish my covenant between me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God unto thee, and to thy seed after thee.
verses.decoded: God promised an everlasting covenant with Abraham and his descendants, pledging to be their God.

verses.kjv: And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.
verses.decoded: God promised Abraham and his descendants the land of Canaan as a permanent inheritance.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, Thou shalt keep my covenant therefore, thou, and thy seed after thee in their generations.
verses.decoded: God instructed Abraham and his descendants to keep the covenant.

verses.kjv: This is my covenant, which ye shall keep, between me and you and thy seed after thee; Every man child among you shall be circumcised.
verses.decoded: God explained that circumcision would be the sign of the covenant for every male.

verses.kjv: And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of the covenant betwixt me and you.
verses.decoded: Circumcision would serve as the physical sign of the covenant between God and His people.

verses.kjv: And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every man child in your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seed.
verses.decoded: Every male, whether born into the household or acquired, was to be circumcised at eight days old.

verses.kjv: He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
verses.decoded: Circumcision was required for all males in the household as a lasting sign of the covenant.

verses.kjv: And the uncircumcised man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken my covenant.
verses.decoded: Anyone who refused the covenant sign would be separated from the community for breaking the covenant.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
verses.decoded: God changed Sarai’s name to Sarah.

verses.kjv: And I will bless her, and give thee a son also of her: yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; kings of people shall be of her.
verses.decoded: God promised that Sarah would give birth to a son and become the mother of nations and kings.

verses.kjv: Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a child be born unto him that is an hundred years old? and shall Sarah, that is ninety years old, bear?
verses.decoded: Abraham laughed in disbelief, wondering how he and Sarah could have a child at such old ages.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!
verses.decoded: Abraham asked God to bless Ishmael instead.

verses.kjv: And God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed; and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.
verses.decoded: God confirmed that Sarah would have a son named Isaac, and that the covenant would continue through him.

verses.kjv: And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.
verses.decoded: God promised to bless Ishmael as well, making him the father of twelve leaders and a great nation.

verses.kjv: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, which Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.
verses.decoded: God clarified that the covenant would be established through Isaac, who would be born the following year.

verses.kjv: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
verses.decoded: God finished speaking and departed from Abraham.

verses.kjv: And Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all that were born in his house, and all that were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham’s house; and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as God had said unto him.
verses.decoded: Abraham immediately obeyed God and circumcised every male in his household that same day.

verses.kjv: And Abraham was ninety years old and nine, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.decoded: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised.

verses.kjv: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.decoded: Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised.

verses.kjv: In the selfsame day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his son.
verses.decoded: Abraham and Ishmael were circumcised on the same day.

verses.kjv: And all the men of his house, born in the house, and bought with money of the stranger, were circumcised with him.
verses.decoded: Every male in Abraham’s household was circumcised along with him. Genesis 18 — The Promise Reaffirmed and Abraham Intercedes

verses.kjv: And the Lord appeared unto him in the plains of Mamre: and he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day;
verses.decoded: The Lord appeared to Abraham while he was sitting at the entrance of his tent during the hottest part of the day.

verses.kjv: And he lift up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself toward the ground,
verses.decoded: Abraham looked up and saw three men nearby, and he ran to greet them respectfully, bowing down.

verses.kjv: And said, My Lord, if now I have found favour in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
verses.decoded: Abraham asked the visitors to stay and not pass by.

verses.kjv: Let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:
verses.decoded: He offered them water to wash their feet and invited them to rest in the shade.

verses.kjv: And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that ye shall pass on: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And they said, So do, as thou hast said.
verses.decoded: Abraham offered them food to refresh them before they continued their journey, and they agreed.

verses.kjv: And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said, Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth.
verses.decoded: Abraham hurried to Sarah and asked her to quickly prepare fresh bread.

verses.kjv: And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good, and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it.
verses.decoded: Abraham selected a choice calf and had it prepared for the guests.

verses.kjv: And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat.
verses.decoded: Abraham served them a full meal and stood nearby while they ate.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he said, Behold, in the tent.
verses.decoded: The visitors asked where Sarah was, and Abraham replied that she was in the tent.

verses.kjv: And he said, I will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard it in the tent door, which was behind him.
verses.decoded: One of them promised to return the next year, and that Sarah would have a son, which Sarah overheard.

verses.kjv: Now Abraham and Sarah were old and well stricken in age; and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
verses.decoded: Abraham and Sarah were very old, and Sarah was past the age of childbearing.

verses.kjv: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?
verses.decoded: Sarah laughed quietly to herself, doubting that she could have a child at her age.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said unto Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of a surety bear a child, which am old?
verses.decoded: The Lord asked Abraham why Sarah laughed and doubted.

verses.kjv: Is any thing too hard for the Lord? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.
verses.decoded: God declared that nothing is impossible for Him and reaffirmed that Sarah would have a son.

verses.kjv: Then Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not; for she was afraid. And he said, Nay; but thou didst laugh.
verses.decoded: Sarah denied laughing because she was afraid, but God corrected her.

verses.kjv: And the men rose up from thence, and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
verses.decoded: The men prepared to leave and looked toward Sodom, and Abraham walked with them.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do;
verses.decoded: The Lord questioned whether He should keep His plans hidden from Abraham.

verses.kjv: Seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
verses.decoded: God acknowledged Abraham’s future importance and influence over all nations.

verses.kjv: For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him, and they shall keep the way of the Lord, to do justice and judgment; that the Lord may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him.
verses.decoded: God trusted Abraham to lead his family in righteousness so that God’s promises would be fulfilled.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous;
verses.decoded: God explained that the outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah was severe because of their great sin.

verses.kjv: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.
verses.decoded: God said He would personally examine the situation to confirm the extent of their wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: And the men turned their faces from thence, and went toward Sodom: but Abraham stood yet before the Lord.
verses.decoded: The men left toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before the Lord.

verses.kjv: And Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
verses.decoded: Abraham approached God and asked if He would destroy righteous people along with the wicked.

verses.kjv: Peradventure there be fifty righteous within the city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are therein?
verses.decoded: Abraham asked if God would spare the city if fifty righteous people were found there.

verses.kjv: That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
verses.decoded: Abraham appealed to God’s justice, trusting that God would do what is right.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.
verses.decoded: God agreed to spare the city if fifty righteous people were found.

verses.kjv: And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord, which am but dust and ashes:
verses.decoded: Abraham humbly acknowledged his position before God.

verses.kjv: Peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous: wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five? And he said, If I find there forty and five, I will not destroy it.
verses.decoded: Abraham asked if God would spare the city for forty-five righteous people, and God agreed.

verses.kjv: And he spake unto him yet again, and said, Peradventure there shall be forty found there. And he said, I will not do it for forty’s sake.
verses.decoded: Abraham continued asking, and God agreed to spare the city for forty righteous people.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak: Peradventure there shall thirty be found there. And he said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.
verses.decoded: Abraham carefully asked about thirty, and God agreed again.

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord: Peradventure there shall be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for twenty’s sake.
verses.decoded: Abraham lowered the number to twenty, and God promised to spare the city for them.

verses.kjv: And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once: Peradventure ten shall be found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for ten’s sake.
verses.decoded: Abraham asked one final time about ten righteous people, and God agreed.

verses.kjv: And the Lord went his way, as soon as he had left communing with Abraham: and Abraham returned unto his place.
verses.decoded: God finished speaking with Abraham and departed, and Abraham returned home. Genesis 19 — The Destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah

verses.kjv: And there came two angels to Sodom at even; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom: and Lot seeing them rose up to meet them; and he bowed himself with his face toward the ground;
verses.decoded: Two angels arrived in Sodom in the evening, and Lot greeted them respectfully at the city gate.

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant’s house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.
verses.decoded: Lot invited them to stay at his house for the night, but they initially said they would sleep in the street.

verses.kjv: And he pressed upon them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his house; and he made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat.
verses.decoded: Lot insisted strongly, so they agreed to stay with him, and he prepared food for them.

verses.kjv: But before they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom, compassed the house round, both old and young, all the people from every quarter:
verses.decoded: Before the guests went to sleep, the men of Sodom surrounded Lot’s house, young and old alike.

verses.kjv: And they called unto Lot, and said unto him, Where are the men which came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may know them.
verses.decoded: The crowd demanded that Lot bring the visitors out so they could abuse them.

verses.kjv: And Lot went out at the door unto them, and shut the door after him,
verses.decoded: Lot stepped outside and shut the door behind him.

verses.kjv: And said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.
verses.decoded: Lot begged them not to commit such evil.

verses.kjv: Behold now, I have two daughters which have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof.
verses.decoded: Lot made a deeply troubling offer to protect his guests, revealing the moral corruption of the city.

verses.kjv: And they said, Stand back. And they said again, This one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a judge: now will we deal worse with thee, than with them. And they pressed sore upon the man, even Lot, and came near to break the door.
verses.decoded: The crowd rejected Lot’s plea, threatened him, and tried to break into the house.

verses.kjv: But the men put forth their hand, and pulled Lot into the house to them, and shut to the door.
verses.decoded: The angels pulled Lot back inside and shut the door.

verses.kjv: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the door.
verses.decoded: The angels struck the attackers with blindness, leaving them confused and unable to find the door.

verses.kjv: And the men said unto Lot, Hast thou here any besides? son in law, and thy sons, and thy daughters, and whatsoever thou hast in the city, bring them out of this place:
verses.decoded: The angels asked Lot if he had any family in the city and told him to gather them.

verses.kjv: For we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxen great before the face of the Lord; and the Lord hath sent us to destroy it.
verses.decoded: They explained that God had sent them to destroy the city because of its great wickedness.

verses.kjv: And Lot went out, and spake unto his sons in law, which married his daughters, and said, Up, get you out of this place; for the Lord will destroy this city. But he seemed as one that mocked unto his sons in law.
verses.decoded: Lot warned his sons-in-law, but they did not take him seriously.

verses.kjv: And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife, and thy two daughters, which are here; lest thou be consumed in the iniquity of the city.
verses.decoded: At dawn, the angels urged Lot to flee with his wife and daughters before the city was destroyed.

verses.kjv: And while he lingered, the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his wife, and upon the hand of his two daughters; the Lord being merciful unto him: and they brought him forth, and set him without the city.
verses.decoded: When Lot hesitated, the angels physically led him and his family out of the city out of God’s mercy.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said, Escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed.
verses.decoded: They warned Lot to flee without looking back and escape to the mountains.

verses.kjv: And Lot said unto them, Oh, not so, my Lord:
verses.decoded: Lot begged for another option.

verses.kjv: Behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shewed unto me in saving my life; and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest some evil take me, and I die:
verses.decoded: Lot feared he would not survive the mountains and pleaded for mercy.

verses.kjv: Behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one: Oh, let me escape thither, (is it not a little one?) and my soul shall live.
verses.decoded: Lot asked to flee to a nearby small city instead.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow this city, for the which thou hast spoken.
verses.decoded: The angel agreed to spare the small city.

verses.kjv: Haste thee, escape thither; for I cannot do any thing till thou be come thither. Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
verses.decoded: Lot was told to hurry, and the city was named Zoar because of its smallness.

verses.kjv: The sun was risen upon the earth when Lot entered into Zoar.
verses.decoded: The sun had risen when Lot arrived in Zoar.

verses.kjv: Then the Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the Lord out of heaven;
verses.decoded: God sent fire and destruction down upon Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.kjv: And he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.
verses.decoded: The cities, their people, and everything growing there were completely destroyed.

verses.kjv: But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.
verses.decoded: Lot’s wife looked back and was turned into a pillar of salt.

verses.kjv: And Abraham gat up early in the morning to the place where he stood before the Lord:
verses.decoded: Abraham went early to the place where he had spoken with God.

verses.kjv: And he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace.
verses.decoded: Abraham saw smoke rising from the land like a furnace.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in the which Lot dwelt.
verses.decoded: God spared Lot because of His promise to Abraham.

verses.kjv: And Lot went up out of Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.
verses.decoded: Lot left Zoar and lived in a cave with his two daughters.

verses.kjv: And the firstborn said unto the younger, Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth:
verses.decoded: The older daughter feared their family line would end.

verses.kjv: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
verses.decoded: The daughters planned to get Lot drunk so they could conceive children by him.

verses.kjv: And they made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
verses.decoded: Lot was unaware of what happened due to intoxication.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, Behold, I lay yesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
verses.decoded: The plan was repeated the next night.

verses.kjv: And they made their father drink wine that night also: and the younger arose, and lay with him; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
verses.decoded: Lot again remained unaware.

verses.kjv: Thus were both the daughters of Lot with child by their father.
verses.decoded: Both daughters became pregnant.

verses.kjv: And the firstborn bare a son, and called his name Moab: the same is the father of the Moabites unto this day.
verses.decoded: The older daughter’s son became the ancestor of the Moabites.

verses.kjv: And the younger, she also bare a son, and called his name Benammi: the same is the father of the children of Ammon unto this day.
verses.decoded: The younger daughter’s son became the ancestor of the Ammonites. Genesis 20 — Abraham and Abimelech

verses.kjv: And Abraham journeyed from thence toward the south country, and dwelled between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned in Gerar.
verses.decoded: Abraham traveled south and settled for a time between Kadesh and Shur, living temporarily in the city of Gerar.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She is my sister: and Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.
verses.decoded: Abraham again said that Sarah was his sister, and King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.

verses.kjv: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, Behold, thou art but a dead man, for the woman which thou hast taken; for she is a man's wife.
verses.decoded: God warned Abimelech in a dream that he was in grave danger because Sarah was already married.

verses.kjv: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, Lord, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?
verses.decoded: Abimelech explained that he had not touched Sarah and asked if God would punish an innocent nation.

verses.kjv: Said he not unto me, She is my sister? and she, even she herself said, He is my brother: in the integrity of my heart and innocency of my hands have I done this.
verses.decoded: Abimelech defended himself, saying both Abraham and Sarah claimed they were siblings, and he acted with a clear conscience.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him in a dream, Yea, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.
verses.decoded: God acknowledged Abimelech’s honesty and explained that He had protected him from committing sin.

verses.kjv: Now therefore restore the man his wife; for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.
verses.decoded: God commanded Abimelech to return Sarah to Abraham, explaining that Abraham was a prophet who would pray for him, warning that refusal would bring death.

verses.kjv: Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid.
verses.decoded: Abimelech immediately told his servants everything, and they were all deeply afraid.

verses.kjv: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us? and what have I offended thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.
verses.decoded: Abimelech confronted Abraham, asking why he had caused such serious trouble for him and his kingdom.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?
verses.decoded: Abimelech asked Abraham what made him act this way.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife's sake.
verses.decoded: Abraham explained that he feared the people did not honor God and might kill him to take Sarah.

verses.kjv: And yet indeed she is my sister; she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.
verses.decoded: Abraham clarified that Sarah was his half-sister, sharing the same father, and later became his wife.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, that I said unto her, This is thy kindness which thou shalt shew unto me; at every place whither we shall come, say of me, He is my brother.
verses.decoded: Abraham explained that this was a long-standing agreement between them whenever they traveled.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and womenservants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.
verses.decoded: Abimelech gave Abraham livestock and servants and returned Sarah to him.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.
verses.decoded: Abimelech invited Abraham to live anywhere in his land.

verses.kjv: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thus she was reproved.
verses.decoded: Abimelech gave silver as compensation, publicly clearing Sarah’s reputation.

verses.kjv: So Abraham prayed unto God: and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maidservants; and they bare children.
verses.decoded: Abraham prayed, and God healed Abimelech’s household so they could have children again.

verses.kjv: For the LORD had fast closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abraham's wife.
verses.decoded: God had previously stopped childbirth in Abimelech’s household because of Sarah. Genesis 21 — The Birth of Isaac and God’s Provision

verses.kjv: And the LORD visited Sarah as he had said, and the LORD did unto Sarah as he had spoken.
verses.decoded: The LORD fulfilled His promise to Sarah exactly as He said He would.

verses.kjv: For Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.
verses.decoded: Sarah became pregnant and gave Abraham a son at the exact time God had promised, even though Abraham was very old.

verses.kjv: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.
verses.decoded: Abraham named his son Isaac, the child Sarah gave birth to.

verses.kjv: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.decoded: Abraham obeyed God and circumcised Isaac when he was eight days old.

verses.kjv: And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
verses.decoded: Abraham was one hundred years old when Isaac was born.

verses.kjv: And Sarah said, God hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me.
verses.decoded: Sarah joyfully said that God had turned her situation into laughter and joy for everyone who heard about it.

verses.kjv: And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have born him a son in his old age.
verses.decoded: Sarah marveled that she, once thought barren, was now nursing a child for Abraham in his old age.

verses.kjv: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.
verses.decoded: As Isaac grew and was weaned, Abraham celebrated the milestone with a great feast.

verses.kjv: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, which she had born unto Abraham, mocking.
verses.decoded: Sarah noticed Ishmael, Hagar’s son, mocking Isaac.

verses.kjv: Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son: for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.
verses.decoded: Sarah demanded that Hagar and her son be sent away, insisting that Isaac alone should inherit.

verses.kjv: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight because of his son.
verses.decoded: Abraham was deeply distressed because Ishmael was his son.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
verses.decoded: God reassured Abraham and told him to listen to Sarah, explaining that Isaac was the chosen heir.

verses.kjv: And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because he is thy seed.
verses.decoded: God promised that Ishmael would also become a great nation because he was Abraham’s son.

verses.kjv: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
verses.decoded: Abraham provided Hagar with food and water and sent her away with Ishmael into the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.
verses.decoded: When the water ran out, Hagar placed Ishmael under a bush.

verses.kjv: And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bowshot: for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.
verses.decoded: Hagar sat at a distance, unable to watch her child die, and cried out in grief.

verses.kjv: And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.
verses.decoded: God heard Ishmael’s cries, and an angel reassured Hagar that God had heard her son.

verses.kjv: Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will make him a great nation.
verses.decoded: God told Hagar to care for Ishmael and promised to make him a great nation.

verses.kjv: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.
verses.decoded: God revealed a nearby well, allowing Hagar to give Ishmael water.

verses.kjv: And God was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became an archer.
verses.decoded: God remained with Ishmael as he grew up in the wilderness and became skilled with a bow.

verses.kjv: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
verses.decoded: Ishmael lived in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother arranged his marriage to an Egyptian woman.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain of his host spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest:
verses.decoded: Abimelech and his commander recognized that God was with Abraham in everything he did.

verses.kjv: Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son: but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
verses.decoded: Abimelech asked Abraham to swear loyalty and honesty toward his family and land.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, I will swear.
verses.decoded: Abraham agreed to the oath.

verses.kjv: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away.
verses.decoded: Abraham confronted Abimelech about a well that his servants had seized.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said, I wot not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.
verses.decoded: Abimelech claimed he was unaware of the situation until that moment.

verses.kjv: And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.
verses.decoded: Abraham gave livestock to Abimelech, and they made a formal agreement.

verses.kjv: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
verses.decoded: Abraham separated seven female lambs from the flock.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?
verses.decoded: Abimelech asked about the meaning of the seven lambs.

verses.kjv: And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.
verses.decoded: Abraham explained that the lambs were proof that the well belonged to him.

verses.kjv: Wherefore he called that place Beersheba; because there they sware both of them.
verses.decoded: The place was named Beersheba because both men swore an oath there.

verses.kjv: Thus they made a covenant at Beersheba: then Abimelech rose up, and Phichol the chief captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
verses.decoded: After making the agreement, Abimelech and his commander returned home.

verses.kjv: And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and called there on the name of the LORD, the everlasting God.
verses.decoded: Abraham planted trees and worshiped the LORD, recognizing Him as the everlasting God.

verses.kjv: And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines' land many days.
verses.decoded: Abraham lived in the land of the Philistines for a long time. Genesis 22 — Abraham Tested and God Provides

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that God did tempt Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham: and he said, Behold, here I am.
verses.decoded: After these events, God tested Abraham by calling to him, and Abraham responded immediately.

verses.kjv: And he said, Take now thy son, thine only son Isaac, whom thou lovest, and get thee into the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.
verses.decoded: God instructed Abraham to take Isaac, his deeply loved and only son, to Moriah and offer him on a mountain God would show him.

verses.kjv: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son, and clave the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went unto the place of which God had told him.
verses.decoded: Abraham obeyed without delay, preparing everything needed and setting out with Isaac and two servants.

verses.kjv: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.
verses.decoded: On the third day, Abraham saw the destination in the distance.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.
verses.decoded: Abraham told the servants to stay behind, saying that he and Isaac would go worship and return.

verses.kjv: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together.
verses.decoded: Abraham placed the wood on Isaac’s back and carried the fire and knife as they walked on together.

verses.kjv: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?
verses.decoded: Isaac questioned his father about where the sacrifice was, noticing they had everything except the lamb.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.
verses.decoded: Abraham expressed his faith that God would provide the sacrifice.

verses.kjv: And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
verses.decoded: Abraham built the altar, arranged the wood, bound Isaac, and placed him on the altar.

verses.kjv: And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.
verses.decoded: Abraham raised the knife, prepared to carry out God’s command.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD called unto him out of heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.
verses.decoded: An angel urgently called out to Abraham, and Abraham answered immediately.

verses.kjv: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.
verses.decoded: The angel stopped Abraham, saying the test proved his reverence and obedience to God.

verses.kjv: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.
verses.decoded: Abraham saw a ram caught nearby and sacrificed it instead of Isaac.

verses.kjv: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovahjireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen.
verses.decoded: Abraham named the place “The LORD Will Provide,” a phrase remembered for generations.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time,
verses.decoded: The angel spoke to Abraham again from heaven.

verses.kjv: And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:
verses.decoded: God swore an oath based on Abraham’s obedience and willingness to surrender his son.

verses.kjv: That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
verses.decoded: God promised abundant blessing and descendants beyond counting, who would overcome their enemies.

verses.kjv: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
verses.decoded: God declared that all nations would be blessed through Abraham’s descendants because of his obedience.

verses.kjv: So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beersheba.
verses.decoded: Abraham reunited with his servants and returned home to Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor;
verses.decoded: Abraham was informed that his brother Nahor’s wife had children.

verses.kjv: Huz his firstborn, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
verses.decoded: The first children listed were Huz, Buz, and Kemuel.

verses.kjv: And Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.
verses.decoded: More of Nahor’s sons were named.

verses.kjv: And Bethuel begat Rebekah: these eight Milcah did bear to Nahor, Abraham's brother.
verses.decoded: Bethuel was the father of Rebekah, completing the list of Milcah’s children.

verses.kjv: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.
verses.decoded: Nahor’s concubine also bore several children, expanding the family line. Genesis 23 — The Death and Burial of Sarah

verses.kjv: And Sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty years old: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
verses.decoded: Sarah lived to be one hundred and twenty-seven years old.

verses.kjv: And Sarah died in Kirjatharba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.
verses.decoded: Sarah died in Hebron, and Abraham openly mourned and wept for her.

verses.kjv: And Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spake unto the sons of Heth, saying,
verses.decoded: After grieving, Abraham approached the people of the land, known as the sons of Heth.

verses.kjv: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
verses.decoded: Abraham explained that he was a foreigner and asked to purchase land so he could bury Sarah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Heth answered Abraham, saying unto him,
verses.decoded: The sons of Heth responded to Abraham.

verses.kjv: Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.
verses.decoded: They honored Abraham, calling him a respected leader and offering any burial place he chose.

verses.kjv: And Abraham stood up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.
verses.decoded: Abraham respectfully bowed to the people.

verses.kjv: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,
verses.decoded: Abraham asked them to speak on his behalf to Ephron, the son of Zohar.

verses.kjv: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you.
verses.decoded: Abraham requested to buy the cave of Machpelah at full value as a permanent burial place.

verses.kjv: And Ephron dwelt among the children of Heth: and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of the children of Heth, even of all that went in at the gate of his city, saying,
verses.decoded: Ephron publicly responded to Abraham in front of the community leaders.

verses.kjv: Nay, my lord, hear me: the field give I thee, and the cave that is therein, I give it thee: in the presence of the sons of my people give I it thee: bury thy dead.
verses.decoded: Ephron offered the field and cave to Abraham as a gift in front of everyone.

verses.kjv: And Abraham bowed down himself before the people of the land.
verses.decoded: Abraham bowed again in respect.

verses.kjv: And he spake unto Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, But if thou wilt give it, I pray thee, hear me: I will give thee money for the field; take it of me, and I will bury my dead there.
verses.decoded: Abraham insisted on paying full price so the land would rightfully belong to him.

verses.kjv: And Ephron answered Abraham, saying unto him,
verses.decoded: Ephron replied to Abraham.

verses.kjv: My lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver; what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
verses.decoded: Ephron named the price and downplayed the cost, encouraging Abraham to proceed.

verses.kjv: And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
verses.decoded: Abraham paid the full price publicly, using standard currency.

verses.kjv: And the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure
verses.decoded: The field, cave, and surrounding land were officially transferred.

verses.kjv: Unto Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all that went in at the gate of his city.
verses.decoded: The purchase was legally confirmed in front of witnesses.

verses.kjv: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Abraham buried Sarah in the cave at Machpelah in Hebron.

verses.kjv: And the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by the sons of Heth.
verses.decoded: The land and cave were permanently secured as Abraham’s family burial place. Genesis 24 — Isaac and Rebekah

verses.kjv: And Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
verses.decoded: Abraham was very old, and the LORD had blessed him in every area of his life.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
verses.decoded: Abraham asked his most trusted servant to make a solemn oath.

verses.kjv: And I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven, and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:
verses.decoded: Abraham required the servant to swear not to choose a wife for Isaac from the Canaanites.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
verses.decoded: The servant was instructed to find a wife for Isaac from Abraham’s own family line.

verses.kjv: And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
verses.decoded: The servant asked what should happen if the woman refused to come.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again.
verses.decoded: Abraham firmly warned him never to take Isaac back to that land.

verses.kjv: The LORD God of heaven, which took me from my father's house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, Unto thy seed will I give this land; he shall send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
verses.decoded: Abraham trusted that God would guide the servant and ensure success.

verses.kjv: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.
verses.decoded: If she refused, the servant would be released from the oath, but Isaac must remain.

verses.kjv: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him concerning that matter.
verses.decoded: The servant made the oath exactly as Abraham required.

verses.kjv: And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.
verses.decoded: The servant set out with gifts and traveled to Abraham’s homeland.

verses.kjv: And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw water.
verses.decoded: He stopped by a well in the evening, when women typically came to draw water.

verses.kjv: And he said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray thee, send me good speed this day, and shew kindness unto my master Abraham.
verses.decoded: The servant prayed for guidance and success.

verses.kjv: Behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:
verses.decoded: He explained his situation to God as he waited by the well.

verses.kjv: And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.
verses.decoded: He asked God for a clear sign to identify the woman chosen for Isaac.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
verses.decoded: Before the prayer ended, Rebekah arrived at the well.

verses.kjv: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
verses.decoded: Rebekah was beautiful, unmarried, and went to draw water.

verses.kjv: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
verses.decoded: The servant asked Rebekah for a drink.

verses.kjv: And she said, Drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
verses.decoded: Rebekah quickly gave him water.

verses.kjv: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw water for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
verses.decoded: She volunteered to water the camels as well.

verses.kjv: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
verses.decoded: Rebekah worked quickly to provide water for every camel.

verses.kjv: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.
verses.decoded: The servant silently watched, recognizing God’s guidance.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
verses.decoded: He gave Rebekah valuable gifts.

verses.kjv: And said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee: is there room in thy father's house for us to lodge in?
verses.decoded: He asked about her family and whether they could stay there.

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, which she bare unto Nahor.
verses.decoded: Rebekah identified herself as Abraham’s relative.

verses.kjv: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
verses.decoded: She assured him there was plenty of space and supplies.

verses.kjv: And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the LORD.
verses.decoded: The servant thanked God in worship.

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master's brethren.
verses.decoded: He praised God for faithfully guiding him.

verses.kjv: And the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's house these things.
verses.decoded: Rebekah hurried home to tell her family.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.
verses.decoded: Her brother Laban went out to meet the servant.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
verses.decoded: Seeing the gifts and hearing the story, Laban approached the servant.

verses.kjv: And he said, Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; wherefore standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
verses.decoded: Laban welcomed the servant warmly.

verses.kjv: And the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.
verses.decoded: The servant and camels were cared for properly.

verses.kjv: And there was set meat before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.
verses.decoded: The servant insisted on explaining his mission before eating.

verses.kjv: And he said, I am Abraham's servant.
verses.decoded: He identified himself clearly.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.
verses.decoded: He described Abraham’s great blessings.

verses.kjv: And Sarah my master's wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
verses.decoded: Isaac was the heir of everything Abraham owned.

verses.kjv: And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
verses.decoded: The servant explained the oath he took.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
verses.decoded: He repeated Abraham’s instructions.

verses.kjv: And I said unto my master, Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
verses.decoded: He recalled his concern.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house:
verses.decoded: Abraham had confidence God would guide the mission.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
verses.decoded: The servant explained the conditions of release.

verses.kjv: And I came this day unto the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go:
verses.decoded: He recounted his prayer at the well.

verses.kjv: Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
verses.decoded: He explained the sign he asked God for.

verses.kjv: And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath appointed out for my master's son.
verses.decoded: The servant described how God answered the prayer perfectly.

verses.kjv: And before I had done speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
verses.decoded: He emphasized how quickly God responded.

verses.kjv: And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
verses.decoded: Rebekah fulfilled the sign exactly.

verses.kjv: And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
verses.decoded: Her identity confirmed God’s guidance.

verses.kjv: And I bowed down my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter unto his son.
verses.decoded: The servant praised God for leading him directly to Isaac’s future wife.

verses.kjv: And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
verses.decoded: He asked for an honest decision.

verses.kjv: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
verses.decoded: They acknowledged God’s will.

verses.kjv: Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the LORD hath spoken.
verses.decoded: They agreed to the marriage.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.
verses.decoded: The servant worshiped God in gratitude.

verses.kjv: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
verses.decoded: He gave generous gifts to Rebekah and her family.

verses.kjv: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.
verses.decoded: The servant requested to return quickly to Abraham.

verses.kjv: And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
verses.decoded: The family asked for more time with Rebekah.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
verses.decoded: The servant urged them not to delay.
