verses.kjv: And they said, We will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.
verses.decoded: They decided to ask Rebekah directly.

verses.kjv: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
verses.decoded: Rebekah willingly chose to go.

verses.kjv: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.
verses.decoded: Rebekah departed with the servant.

verses.kjv: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
verses.decoded: Her family blessed her with promises of great descendants.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
verses.decoded: Rebekah traveled with the servant toward Isaac.

verses.kjv: And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.
verses.decoded: Isaac was living in the southern region.

verses.kjv: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.
verses.decoded: Isaac was meditating when he saw the caravan approaching.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted off the camel.
verses.decoded: Rebekah saw Isaac and dismounted respectfully.

verses.kjv: For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.
verses.decoded: Rebekah covered herself when she learned the man was Isaac.

verses.kjv: And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
verses.decoded: The servant explained the entire journey to Isaac.

verses.kjv: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
verses.decoded: Isaac married Rebekah, loved her, and found comfort after losing his mother. Genesis 25 — Abraham’s Later Years, Ishmael’s Line, and Jacob & Esau

verses.kjv: Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
verses.decoded: After Sarah’s death, Abraham married another woman named Keturah.

verses.kjv: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
verses.decoded: Keturah had several sons with Abraham.

verses.kjv: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
verses.decoded: Jokshan’s descendants included Sheba and Dedan, and Dedan had multiple family lines.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
verses.decoded: Midian also had several sons, and all these descendants came through Keturah.

verses.kjv: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
verses.decoded: Abraham gave his full inheritance to Isaac.

verses.kjv: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
verses.decoded: Abraham gave gifts to his other sons and sent them away east so Isaac’s inheritance would not be divided.

verses.kjv: And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
verses.decoded: Abraham lived to be one hundred and seventy-five years old.

verses.kjv: Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
verses.decoded: Abraham died peacefully at an old age and was reunited with his ancestors in death.

verses.kjv: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;
verses.decoded: Isaac and Ishmael came together to bury Abraham in the family burial place.

verses.kjv: The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
verses.decoded: Abraham was buried in the land he had legally purchased, where Sarah was also buried.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahairoi.
verses.decoded: After Abraham’s death, God blessed Isaac, who lived near the well Lahairoi.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bare unto Abraham:
verses.decoded: The account shifts to list the descendants of Ishmael, Abraham’s son through Hagar.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebajoth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
verses.decoded: Ishmael had many sons, beginning with Nebajoth and others listed here.

verses.kjv: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
verses.decoded: More of Ishmael’s sons are named.

verses.kjv: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
verses.decoded: The list continues with additional sons.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.
verses.decoded: Ishmael’s sons became twelve leaders, each forming their own communities and tribes.

verses.kjv: And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was gathered unto his people.
verses.decoded: Ishmael lived to be one hundred and thirty-seven years old and then died.

verses.kjv: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.
verses.decoded: Ishmael’s descendants lived across a wide region, and he died among his relatives.

verses.kjv: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begat Isaac:
verses.decoded: The story now shifts to Isaac’s family line.

verses.kjv: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
verses.decoded: Isaac married Rebekah at forty years old; she was from Abraham’s extended family.

verses.kjv: And Isaac intreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
verses.decoded: Isaac prayed earnestly because Rebekah could not have children, and God answered by allowing her to conceive.

verses.kjv: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.
verses.decoded: Rebekah felt the babies struggling inside her and asked God why it was happening.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
verses.decoded: God revealed that her twins would become two nations, and the younger would eventually surpass the older.

verses.kjv: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
verses.decoded: When the time came, she gave birth to twins.

verses.kjv: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
verses.decoded: The first baby, Esau, was born with a reddish appearance and lots of hair.

verses.kjv: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
verses.decoded: Jacob was born holding Esau’s heel, and Isaac was sixty years old when the twins were born.

verses.kjv: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.
verses.decoded: As they grew, Esau became an outdoorsman and hunter, while Jacob lived a quieter home-centered life.

verses.kjv: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.
verses.decoded: Isaac favored Esau for his hunting, while Rebekah favored Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:
verses.decoded: Jacob was cooking stew when Esau came home exhausted.

verses.kjv: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
verses.decoded: Esau begged for the red stew, and because of this, he was also associated with the name Edom.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.
verses.decoded: Jacob demanded Esau’s birthright in exchange for food.

verses.kjv: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
verses.decoded: Esau treated the birthright as worthless compared to his immediate hunger.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
verses.decoded: Jacob required an oath, and Esau agreed, giving up his birthright.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.
verses.decoded: Esau ate, left, and showed that he valued immediate comfort over long-term blessing.

verses.kjv: And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.
verses.decoded: Another famine struck the land, similar to the one during Abraham’s time, and Isaac went to Abimelech, the Philistine king in Gerar.

verses.kjv: And the Lord appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:
verses.decoded: God appeared to Isaac and told him not to go to Egypt, but to stay where God directed him.

verses.kjv: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee: for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;
verses.decoded: God told Isaac to remain there, promising His presence and blessing, and reaffirming the covenant made with Abraham.

verses.kjv: And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
verses.decoded: God promised Isaac countless descendants and said all nations would be blessed through his lineage.

verses.kjv: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
verses.decoded: These promises continued because Abraham obeyed God and followed His instructions faithfully.

verses.kjv: And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
verses.decoded: Isaac obeyed and stayed in Gerar.

verses.kjv: And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife…
verses.decoded: Isaac lied out of fear, saying Rebekah was his sister because he worried the men might kill him because of her beauty.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window…
verses.decoded: After Isaac had lived there for some time, Abimelech noticed Isaac showing affection to Rebekah.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife…
verses.decoded: Abimelek confronted Isaac, realizing Rebekah was actually his wife.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife…
verses.decoded: Abimelek warned Isaac that his lie could have caused serious harm and guilt among the people.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
verses.decoded: Abimelek ordered everyone to protect Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.kjv: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
verses.decoded: Isaac planted crops and experienced an extraordinary harvest because God blessed him.

verses.kjv: And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
verses.decoded: Isaac became increasingly wealthy and successful.

verses.kjv: For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants…
verses.decoded: Isaac’s prosperity caused envy among the Philistines.

verses.kjv: For all the wells which his father’s servants had digged…
verses.decoded: The Philistines filled in the wells that Abraham’s servants had dug.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
verses.decoded: Isaac was asked to leave because his success had made others uncomfortable.

verses.kjv: And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar…
verses.decoded: Isaac moved and settled in the Valley of Gerar.

verses.kjv: And Isaac digged again the wells of water…
verses.decoded: Isaac reopened the wells his father had originally dug.

verses.kjv: And Isaac’s servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
verses.decoded: Isaac’s servants discovered fresh, flowing water.

verses.kjv: And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac’s herdmen…
verses.decoded: Local herders argued over ownership of the water.

verses.kjv: And they digged another well, and strove for that also…
verses.decoded: Another well was dug, but conflict followed again.

verses.kjv: And he removed from thence, and digged another well…
verses.decoded: Isaac moved again, dug another well, and finally found peace, naming it Rehoboth because God had made room for him.

verses.kjv: And he went up from thence to Beersheba.
verses.decoded: Isaac traveled to Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And the Lord appeared unto him the same night…
verses.decoded: God reassured Isaac, telling him not to fear and repeating His promise of blessing.

verses.kjv: And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the Lord…
verses.decoded: Isaac worshiped God, settled there, and his servants dug another well.

verses.kjv: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar…
verses.decoded: Abimelek approached Isaac with advisors and military leaders.

verses.kjv: And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come ye to me…
verses.decoded: Isaac questioned why they came after previously sending him away.

verses.kjv: And they said, We saw certainly that the Lord was with thee…
verses.decoded: They admitted they recognized God’s favor on Isaac and wanted peace.

verses.kjv: That thou wilt do us no hurt…
verses.decoded: They requested a treaty, acknowledging Isaac’s blessing.

verses.kjv: And he made them a feast…
verses.decoded: Isaac hosted them as a sign of peace.

verses.kjv: And they rose up betimes in the morning…
verses.decoded: They made a formal agreement and parted peacefully.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same day…
verses.decoded: Isaac’s servants reported finding water.

verses.kjv: And he called it Shebah…
verses.decoded: Isaac named the well, and the place became known as Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife…
verses.decoded: Esau married women from the Hittites.

verses.kjv: Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
verses.decoded: These marriages caused deep sorrow and distress for Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.
verses.decoded: When Isaac grew old and was nearly blind, he called his oldest son Esau. Esau answered and made himself available to his father.

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:
verses.decoded: Isaac acknowledged his old age and admitted he did not know how much time he had left to live.

verses.kjv: Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
verses.decoded: Isaac asked Esau to take his hunting gear and go out to hunt wild game for him.

verses.kjv: And make me savoury meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
verses.decoded: Isaac wanted his favorite meal prepared so that he could eat and give Esau his blessing before he died.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
verses.decoded: Rebekah overheard Isaac’s conversation with Esau as Esau went out to hunt.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,
verses.decoded: Rebekah immediately told Jacob that she had heard Isaac speaking to Esau.

verses.kjv: Bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the LORD before my death.
verses.decoded: She repeated Isaac’s plan to bless Esau after eating the meal.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.
verses.decoded: Rebekah instructed Jacob to listen carefully and follow her directions.

verses.kjv: Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
verses.decoded: She told Jacob to bring her two young goats so she could prepare Isaac’s favorite meal.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
verses.decoded: Rebekah planned for Jacob to bring the food to Isaac so Jacob could receive the blessing instead.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:
verses.decoded: Jacob pointed out that Esau was hairy while he himself was not.

verses.kjv: My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
verses.decoded: Jacob feared that Isaac would discover the deception and curse him instead of blessing him.

verses.kjv: And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
verses.decoded: Rebekah took responsibility for the plan and urged Jacob to obey her.

verses.kjv: And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.
verses.decoded: Jacob followed her instructions, and Rebekah prepared the meal Isaac loved.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son:
verses.decoded: Rebekah dressed Jacob in Esau’s clothing to help disguise him.

verses.kjv: And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
verses.decoded: She covered Jacob’s hands and neck with goat skins to imitate Esau’s hair.

verses.kjv: And she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
verses.decoded: Rebekah gave Jacob the food to bring to Isaac.

verses.kjv: And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
verses.decoded: Jacob approached Isaac, who questioned his identity.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy firstborn; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
verses.decoded: Jacob lied, claiming to be Esau, and asked Isaac to eat and bless him.

verses.kjv: And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the LORD thy God brought it to me.
verses.decoded: Isaac questioned the speed of the hunt, and Jacob falsely credited God.

verses.kjv: And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.
verses.decoded: Isaac asked Jacob to come closer so he could confirm his identity by touch.

verses.kjv: And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
verses.decoded: Isaac noticed the voice sounded like Jacob, but the hands felt like Esau’s.

verses.kjv: And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands: so he blessed him.
verses.decoded: Isaac was deceived by the disguise and gave Jacob the blessing.

verses.kjv: And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
verses.decoded: Isaac asked again, and Jacob continued the lie.

verses.kjv: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
verses.decoded: Isaac ate the meal and drank wine, preparing to bless him.

verses.kjv: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
verses.decoded: Isaac asked Jacob to come closer and kiss him.

verses.kjv: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD hath blessed:
verses.decoded: Isaac smelled Esau’s clothes on Jacob and believed him, then spoke a blessing.

verses.kjv: Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
verses.decoded: Isaac blessed him with abundance, prosperity, and provision.

verses.kjv: Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
verses.decoded: Isaac declared that Jacob would rule over others and receive divine favor.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
verses.decoded: Right after Jacob left, Esau returned from hunting.

verses.kjv: And he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.
verses.decoded: Esau presented the meal and asked for his blessing.

verses.kjv: And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy firstborn Esau.
verses.decoded: Isaac was confused when Esau identified himself.

verses.kjv: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
verses.decoded: Isaac realized he had been deceived and acknowledged the blessing could not be undone.

verses.kjv: And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.
verses.decoded: Esau was devastated and begged for a blessing.

verses.kjv: And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
verses.decoded: Isaac explained that Jacob had taken the blessing through deception.

verses.kjv: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
verses.decoded: Esau expressed bitterness, feeling cheated twice by Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son?
verses.decoded: Isaac explained that the primary blessing had already been given.

verses.kjv: And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.decoded: Esau begged again, overwhelmed with grief.

verses.kjv: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;
verses.decoded: Isaac gave Esau a lesser blessing tied to earthly survival.

verses.kjv: And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
verses.decoded: Esau’s life would be marked by struggle, conflict, and eventual resistance.

verses.kjv: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
verses.decoded: Esau began to hate Jacob and planned revenge after Isaac’s death.

verses.kjv: And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
verses.decoded: Rebekah learned of Esau’s plan and warned Jacob.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
verses.decoded: Rebekah instructed Jacob to flee for his safety.

verses.kjv: And tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away;
verses.decoded: She hoped Esau’s anger would eventually cool.

verses.kjv: Until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?
verses.decoded: Rebekah feared losing both sons if violence occurred.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
verses.decoded: Rebekah expressed concern over Jacob marrying outside their values, using it as a reason to protect him.

verses.kjv: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Isaac blessed Jacob and gave him a clear instruction not to marry women from the Canaanite people.

verses.kjv: Arise, go to Padanaram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother's father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother's brother.
verses.decoded: Isaac told Jacob to travel to Padanaram and choose a wife from Rebekah’s family line.

verses.kjv: And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
verses.decoded: Isaac prayed that God would bless Jacob with growth, increase, and a large family.

verses.kjv: And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
verses.decoded: Isaac passed down Abraham’s covenant blessing, including the promise of land and legacy.

verses.kjv: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
verses.decoded: Jacob left home and traveled to Padanaram to stay with his uncle Laban.

verses.kjv: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
verses.decoded: Esau noticed that Jacob was blessed and sent away with instructions about marriage.

verses.kjv: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padanaram;
verses.decoded: Esau saw that Jacob obeyed both Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.kjv: And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
verses.decoded: Esau realized his Canaanite wives did not please his father.

verses.kjv: Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
verses.decoded: Esau tried to correct his mistake by marrying within Abraham’s extended family.

verses.kjv: And Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.
verses.decoded: Jacob left Beersheba and began his journey toward Haran.

verses.kjv: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
verses.decoded: Jacob stopped for the night, using stones as pillows, and went to sleep outdoors.

verses.kjv: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
verses.decoded: Jacob dreamed of a stairway connecting earth and heaven, with angels moving between the two.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
verses.decoded: God revealed Himself and promised Jacob the land where he was resting.

verses.kjv: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.decoded: God promised Jacob countless descendants and worldwide influence through his family line.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
verses.decoded: God assured Jacob of protection, guidance, and His constant presence.

verses.kjv: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
verses.decoded: Jacob realized God had been present even when he was unaware.

verses.kjv: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
verses.decoded: Jacob felt awe and reverence, recognizing the place as sacred.

verses.kjv: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
verses.decoded: Jacob marked the moment by setting up a stone as a memorial and dedicating it to God.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of that place Bethel: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.
verses.decoded: Jacob renamed the place Bethel, meaning “house of God.”

verses.kjv: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
verses.decoded: Jacob made a vow, asking God for protection and provision.

verses.kjv: So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the LORD be my God:
verses.decoded: Jacob promised loyalty to God if he returned home safely.

verses.kjv: And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
verses.decoded: Jacob committed to honoring God and giving back a portion of what God would bless him with.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
verses.decoded: Jacob continued his journey and arrived in the eastern region.

verses.kjv: And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well's mouth.
verses.decoded: Jacob saw a well in the field with three flocks of sheep resting nearby, covered by a large stone.

verses.kjv: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well's mouth in his place.
verses.decoded: All the flocks were gathered before the stone was removed to water the sheep, then replaced afterward.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.
verses.decoded: Jacob asked the shepherds where they were from, and they told him they were from Haran.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
verses.decoded: Jacob asked if they knew Laban, and they confirmed that they did.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
verses.decoded: They told Jacob that Laban was doing well and that his daughter Rachel was approaching with the sheep.

verses.kjv: And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
verses.decoded: Jacob questioned why the sheep had not been watered yet since it was still early in the day.

verses.kjv: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.
verses.decoded: The shepherds explained that the stone could only be moved once all flocks were present.

verses.kjv: And while he yet spake with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep: for she kept them.
verses.decoded: Rachel arrived while Jacob was speaking, as she was responsible for her father’s sheep.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother.
verses.decoded: When Jacob realized who Rachel was, he personally moved the stone and watered Laban’s sheep.

verses.kjv: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.decoded: Overcome with emotion, Jacob kissed Rachel and began to cry.

verses.kjv: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was Rebekah's son: and she ran and told her father.
verses.decoded: Jacob explained their family connection, and Rachel immediately told Laban.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
verses.decoded: Laban warmly welcomed Jacob and listened to his story.

verses.kjv: And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
verses.decoded: Laban acknowledged Jacob as family, and Jacob stayed with him for a month.

verses.kjv: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
verses.decoded: Laban asked Jacob what payment he wanted for his work.

verses.kjv: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
verses.decoded: Laban had two daughters, Leah the older and Rachel the younger.

verses.kjv: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
verses.decoded: Leah was gentle in appearance, while Rachel was strikingly beautiful.

verses.kjv: And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
verses.decoded: Jacob loved Rachel and offered to work seven years to marry her.

verses.kjv: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
verses.decoded: Laban agreed, saying it was better for Jacob to marry Rachel than someone else.

verses.kjv: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
verses.decoded: The seven years felt short to Jacob because of how deeply he loved Rachel.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.
verses.decoded: After seven years, Jacob asked Laban to give him Rachel as his wife.

verses.kjv: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
verses.decoded: Laban held a wedding feast.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
verses.decoded: That night, Laban deceived Jacob by giving him Leah instead of Rachel.

verses.kjv: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
verses.decoded: Leah was given Zilpah as her servant.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
verses.decoded: Jacob realized the deception and confronted Laban.

verses.kjv: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
verses.decoded: Laban claimed it was custom for the older daughter to marry first.

verses.kjv: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
verses.decoded: Laban required Jacob to work seven more years to marry Rachel.

verses.kjv: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.
verses.decoded: Jacob agreed and was later given Rachel as his wife.

verses.kjv: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
verses.decoded: Rachel was given Bilhah as her servant.

verses.kjv: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
verses.decoded: Jacob loved Rachel more than Leah and worked seven additional years.

verses.kjv: And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren.
verses.decoded: God showed compassion to Leah by allowing her to conceive, while Rachel could not.

verses.kjv: And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the LORD hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
verses.decoded: Leah named her son Reuben, hoping her husband would finally love her.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Because the LORD hath heard that I was hated, he hath therefore given me this son also: and she called his name Simeon.
verses.decoded: Leah named her second son Simeon, believing God saw her pain.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have born him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
verses.decoded: Leah hoped a third son would finally bond her husband to her.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, Now will I praise the LORD: therefore she called his name Judah; and left bearing.
verses.decoded: Leah shifted her focus to praising God, naming her son Judah.

verses.kjv: And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister; and said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.
verses.decoded: Rachel, unable to have children, became deeply distressed and desperate, expressing her pain to Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
verses.decoded: Jacob responded sharply, reminding Rachel that only God controls fertility.

verses.kjv: And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.
verses.decoded: Rachel offered her servant Bilhah to Jacob so she could have children through her.

verses.kjv: And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife: and Jacob went in unto her.
verses.decoded: Rachel gave Bilhah to Jacob as a wife, and Jacob accepted.

verses.kjv: And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.
verses.decoded: Bilhah became pregnant and gave Jacob a son.

verses.kjv: And Rachel said, God hath judged me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a son: therefore called she his name Dan.
verses.decoded: Rachel believed God had answered her and named the child Dan.

verses.kjv: And Bilhah Rachel's maid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.
verses.decoded: Bilhah gave Jacob another son.

verses.kjv: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.
verses.decoded: Rachel viewed her rivalry with Leah as a struggle and named the child Naphtali.

verses.kjv: When Leah saw that she had left bearing, she took Zilpah her maid, and gave her Jacob to wife.
verses.decoded: Leah, no longer having children, gave her servant Zilpah to Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a son.
verses.decoded: Zilpah gave birth to a son for Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, A troop cometh: and she called his name Gad.
verses.decoded: Leah named the child Gad, expressing a sense of fortune or blessing.

verses.kjv: And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a second son.
verses.decoded: Zilpah gave Jacob another son.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, Happy am I, for the daughters will call me blessed: and she called his name Asher.
verses.decoded: Leah felt joy and gratitude, naming the child Asher.

verses.kjv: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son's mandrakes.
verses.decoded: Reuben brought his mother mandrakes, and Rachel asked for some.

verses.kjv: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son's mandrakes.
verses.decoded: Leah accused Rachel of taking Jacob’s affection, and they negotiated time with Jacob in exchange for the mandrakes.

verses.kjv: And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in unto me; for surely I have hired thee with my son's mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.
verses.decoded: Leah explained the agreement, and Jacob stayed with her that night.

verses.kjv: And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived, and bare Jacob the fifth son.
verses.decoded: God responded to Leah, and she became pregnant again.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, God hath given me my hire, because I have given my maiden to my husband: and she called his name Issachar.
verses.decoded: Leah believed God rewarded her and named the child Issachar.

verses.kjv: And Leah conceived again, and bare Jacob the sixth son.
verses.decoded: Leah gave birth to Jacob’s sixth son.

verses.kjv: And Leah said, God hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have born him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.
verses.decoded: Leah hoped this child would finally secure Jacob’s affection and named him Zebulun.

verses.kjv: And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.
verses.decoded: Leah later gave birth to a daughter named Dinah.

verses.kjv: And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to her, and opened her womb.
verses.decoded: God responded to Rachel’s prayers and allowed her to conceive.

verses.kjv: And she conceived, and bare a son; and said, God hath taken away my reproach:
verses.decoded: Rachel felt relieved and restored after giving birth.

verses.kjv: And she called his name Joseph; and said, The LORD shall add to me another son.
verses.decoded: Rachel named her son Joseph, expressing hope for another child.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Rachel had born Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country.
verses.decoded: After Joseph’s birth, Jacob asked to return home.

verses.kjv: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my service which I have done thee.
verses.decoded: Jacob requested his family and acknowledged his years of labor.

verses.kjv: And Laban said unto him, I pray thee, if I have found favour in thine eyes, tarry: for I have learned by experience that the LORD hath blessed me for thy sake.
verses.decoded: Laban admitted that God had prospered him because of Jacob.

verses.kjv: And he said, Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.
verses.decoded: Laban asked Jacob to name his payment.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy cattle was with me.
verses.decoded: Jacob reminded Laban of his faithful service.

verses.kjv: For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and the LORD hath blessed thee since my coming: and now when shall I provide for mine own house also?
verses.decoded: Jacob pointed out how Laban’s wealth grew through his work.

verses.kjv: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me any thing: if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed and keep thy flock:
verses.decoded: Jacob proposed a new arrangement instead of direct payment.

verses.kjv: I will pass through all thy flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted cattle, and all the brown cattle among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats: and of such shall be my hire.
verses.decoded: Jacob requested the unusually colored animals as his wages.

verses.kjv: So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before thy face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.
verses.decoded: Jacob explained that honesty would prove his integrity.

verses.kjv: And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to thy word.
verses.decoded: Laban agreed to the terms.

verses.kjv: And he removed that day the he goats that were ringstraked and spotted, and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.
verses.decoded: Laban tried to manipulate the agreement by separating the animals.

verses.kjv: And he set three days' journey betwixt himself and Jacob: and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.
verses.decoded: Laban distanced himself, leaving Jacob with the remaining flocks.

verses.kjv: And Jacob took him rods of green poplar, and of the hazel and chesnut tree; and pilled white strakes in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.
verses.decoded: Jacob prepared wooden rods with stripped bark.

verses.kjv: And he set the rods which he had pilled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.
verses.decoded: Jacob placed the rods where the animals drank and mated.

verses.kjv: And the flocks conceived before the rods, and brought forth cattle ringstraked, speckled, and spotted.
verses.decoded: The animals produced offspring matching Jacob’s wages.

verses.kjv: And Jacob did separate the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the ringstraked, and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto Laban's cattle.
verses.decoded: Jacob separated his animals from Laban’s.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger cattle did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the cattle in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods.
verses.decoded: Jacob focused on the breeding of the stronger animals.

verses.kjv: But when the cattle were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were Laban's, and the stronger Jacob's.
verses.decoded: The weaker animals stayed with Laban, and the stronger belonged to Jacob.

verses.kjv: And the man increased exceedingly, and had much cattle, and maidservants, and menservants, and camels, and asses.
verses.decoded: Jacob became extremely wealthy and prosperous.

verses.kjv: And he heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father's; and of that which was our father's hath he gotten all this glory.
verses.decoded: Jacob heard Laban’s sons accusing him of taking their father’s wealth and building his own success from it.

verses.kjv: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
verses.decoded: Jacob noticed Laban’s attitude toward him had changed and wasn’t friendly anymore.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
verses.decoded: God told Jacob to return home to his family and promised to be with him.

verses.kjv: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,
verses.decoded: Jacob called Rachel and Leah out to the field where he was tending the flocks.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, I see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.
verses.decoded: Jacob told them their father’s attitude had shifted, but God had still protected and helped him.

verses.kjv: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
verses.decoded: Jacob reminded them he had worked extremely hard for Laban.

verses.kjv: And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.
verses.decoded: Jacob explained that Laban kept cheating him and changing the deal, but God didn’t allow Laban to ruin him.

verses.kjv: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then bare all the cattle ringstraked.
verses.decoded: Jacob said that no matter how Laban tried to switch the terms, the animals still produced in a way that worked in Jacob’s favor.

verses.kjv: Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.
verses.decoded: Jacob credited God for transferring the increase from Laban to him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.
verses.decoded: Jacob described a dream where he saw the breeding animals marked in the same patterns tied to his wages.

verses.kjv: And the angel of God spake unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.
verses.decoded: An angel spoke to Jacob in a dream, and Jacob responded.

verses.kjv: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
verses.decoded: The angel told Jacob God had seen Laban’s dishonesty and was addressing it.

verses.kjv: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.
verses.decoded: God reminded Jacob of Bethel and instructed him to leave and return to his homeland.

verses.kjv: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?
verses.decoded: Rachel and Leah asked if their father had left them anything at all.

verses.kjv: Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.
verses.decoded: They said Laban treated them like outsiders and used them for profit.

verses.kjv: For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children's: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.
verses.decoded: They agreed the wealth rightly belonged to their household now and told Jacob to do what God instructed.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
verses.decoded: Jacob prepared to leave and placed his family on camels.

verses.kjv: And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gotten, the cattle of his getting, which he had gotten in Padanaram, for to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Jacob left with all his livestock and possessions to return to Isaac in Canaan.

verses.kjv: And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father's.
verses.decoded: While Laban was away shearing sheep, Rachel secretly took her father’s household idols.

verses.kjv: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.
verses.decoded: Jacob left without telling Laban, slipping away quietly.

verses.kjv: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.
verses.decoded: Jacob escaped with everything and headed toward the mountains of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.
verses.decoded: Laban found out three days later that Jacob had left.

verses.kjv: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.
verses.decoded: Laban chased Jacob for seven days and caught up with him in the mountains.

verses.kjv: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.decoded: God warned Laban in a dream not to threaten or manipulate Jacob.

verses.kjv: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.
verses.decoded: Laban caught Jacob, and both groups camped in the mountains of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?
verses.decoded: Laban accused Jacob of sneaking off and treating his daughters like prisoners.

verses.kjv: Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
verses.decoded: Laban claimed he would have sent Jacob off with celebration if Jacob had told him.

verses.kjv: And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
verses.decoded: Laban complained that Jacob didn’t let him say goodbye properly.

verses.kjv: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.decoded: Laban admitted he could have harmed them, but God warned him not to act.

verses.kjv: And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father's house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
verses.decoded: Laban asked why Jacob would leave—and accused him of stealing his idols.

verses.kjv: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters from me.
verses.decoded: Jacob said he left secretly because he feared Laban would take the women back by force.

verses.kjv: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.decoded: Jacob confidently said the person who had the idols should die, not knowing Rachel had taken them.

verses.kjv: And Laban went into Jacob's tent, and into Leah's tent, and into the two maidservants' tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent.
verses.decoded: Laban searched each tent, moving from one to the next, and finally searched Rachel’s.

verses.kjv: Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel's furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
verses.decoded: Rachel hid the idols in the saddle area and sat on them so Laban couldn’t find them.

verses.kjv: And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.
verses.decoded: Rachel excused herself from standing by claiming her monthly cycle, and Laban still found nothing.

verses.kjv: And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?
verses.decoded: Jacob became angry and demanded to know what he had done to deserve being chased down.

verses.kjv: Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.
verses.decoded: Jacob told Laban to show proof publicly if he found anything stolen.

verses.kjv: This twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
verses.decoded: Jacob reminded Laban he had served faithfully for twenty years and never abused the flock.

verses.kjv: That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.
verses.decoded: Jacob said he personally covered losses instead of blaming Laban.

verses.kjv: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
verses.decoded: Jacob described the harsh working conditions and how he barely rested.

verses.kjv: Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
verses.decoded: Jacob detailed his years of labor and Laban’s repeated deception.

verses.kjv: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
verses.decoded: Jacob said God defended him and exposed Laban’s wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?
verses.decoded: Laban claimed ownership of everything but admitted he couldn’t change what had happened.

verses.kjv: Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
verses.decoded: Laban proposed a formal agreement as a witness between them.

verses.kjv: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
verses.decoded: Jacob set up a stone pillar as a marker.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.
verses.decoded: They built a pile of stones and shared a meal there to confirm the covenant.

verses.kjv: And Laban called it Jegarsahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.decoded: Laban and Jacob gave the stone heap different names in their own languages.

verses.kjv: And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;
verses.decoded: Laban declared the stone heap a witness of their agreement.

verses.kjv: And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
verses.decoded: Laban asked God to watch over both of them when they were apart.

verses.kjv: If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
verses.decoded: Laban warned Jacob to treat his daughters well, saying God would hold him accountable.

verses.kjv: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee;
verses.decoded: Laban pointed to the stones as the boundary and reminder of their covenant.

verses.kjv: This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.
verses.decoded: They agreed not to cross this boundary to hurt each other.

verses.kjv: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.
verses.decoded: They called on God as judge, and Jacob swore his oath by the God Isaac reverenced.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.
verses.decoded: Jacob offered a sacrifice, and everyone shared a meal and stayed the night.

verses.kjv: And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
verses.decoded: Laban said goodbye, blessed his family, and returned home.

verses.kjv: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
verses.decoded: As Jacob continued his journey, God’s angels met him, confirming God was still with him.

verses.kjv: And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God's host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
verses.decoded: Jacob recognized the angels as God’s army and named the place Mahanaim.

verses.kjv: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
verses.decoded: Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Edom.

verses.kjv: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:
verses.decoded: Jacob told the messengers to speak humbly to Esau and explain he had been living with Laban.

verses.kjv: And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
verses.decoded: Jacob told Esau he had possessions and servants, and he wanted to make peace and be accepted.

verses.kjv: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
verses.decoded: The messengers reported that Esau was coming toward Jacob with four hundred men.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the flocks, and herds, and the camels, into two bands;
verses.decoded: Jacob became terrified and split his people and livestock into two groups.

verses.kjv: And said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape.
verses.decoded: Jacob’s plan was that if Esau attacked one group, the other could escape.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will deal well with thee:
verses.decoded: Jacob prayed to the God of Abraham and Isaac, reminding God of His promise to protect him.

verses.kjv: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast shewed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.
verses.decoded: Jacob admitted he didn’t deserve God’s kindness and acknowledged how far God had brought him.

verses.kjv: Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me, and the mother with the children.
verses.decoded: Jacob begged God to rescue him because he feared Esau would destroy his whole family.

verses.kjv: And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
verses.decoded: Jacob reminded God of the promise that his descendants would be countless.

verses.kjv: And he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother;
verses.decoded: Jacob stayed there overnight and prepared gifts for Esau.

verses.kjv: Two hundred she goats, and twenty he goats, two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,
verses.decoded: Jacob selected large numbers of goats and sheep as part of the gift.

verses.kjv: Thirty milch camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bulls, twenty she asses, and ten foals.
verses.decoded: He also included camels, cows, bulls, donkeys, and young animals.

verses.kjv: And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves; and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
verses.decoded: Jacob organized the gifts into separate groups and spaced them out to make the offering feel even bigger.

verses.kjv: And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
verses.decoded: Jacob instructed the first servant what to say when Esau questioned them.

verses.kjv: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.
verses.decoded: They were to say the animals belonged to Jacob and were a gift for Esau, with Jacob coming behind.

verses.kjv: And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him.
verses.decoded: Jacob gave the same instructions to every group of servants.

verses.kjv: And say ye moreover, Behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept of me.
verses.decoded: Jacob hoped the repeated gifts would calm Esau’s anger so Esau would accept him.

verses.kjv: So went the present over before him: and himself lodged that night in the company.
verses.decoded: The gifts went ahead, while Jacob stayed back that night with his camp.

verses.kjv: And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two womenservants, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford Jabbok.
verses.decoded: During the night, Jacob moved his family across the Jabbok river crossing.

verses.kjv: And he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had.
verses.decoded: Jacob sent his family and everything he owned across the water.

verses.kjv: And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
verses.decoded: Jacob was left alone, and a man wrestled with him until dawn.

verses.kjv: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
verses.decoded: When the man couldn’t overpower Jacob, he struck Jacob’s hip, dislocating it.

verses.kjv: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
verses.decoded: The man asked to be released, but Jacob refused unless he received a blessing.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
verses.decoded: The man asked Jacob his name, and Jacob answered.

verses.kjv: And he said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for as a prince hast thou power with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
verses.decoded: The man renamed Jacob “Israel,” saying he had struggled and endured with God and with people.

verses.kjv: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
verses.decoded: Jacob asked the man’s name, but the man avoided answering and blessed Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
verses.decoded: Jacob named the place Peniel because he believed he had encountered God and survived.

verses.kjv: And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.
verses.decoded: As Jacob left, the sun rose, and he limped because of his injured hip.

verses.kjv: Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew that shrank.
verses.decoded: This event became the reason Israelites avoided eating that specific tendon near the hip.

verses.kjv: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
verses.decoded: Jacob looked up and saw Esau approaching with four hundred men, so he carefully arranged his family.

verses.kjv: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
verses.decoded: Jacob placed the servants and their children first, then Leah and her children, and Rachel and Joseph last.

verses.kjv: And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
verses.decoded: Jacob went ahead of his family and bowed deeply seven times as a sign of humility and respect.

verses.kjv: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.
verses.decoded: Esau ran to Jacob, hugged him, kissed him, and they both cried in reconciliation.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The children which God hath graciously given thy servant.
verses.decoded: Esau asked about Jacob’s family, and Jacob credited God for his children.

verses.kjv: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
verses.decoded: The servants and their children approached Esau and bowed respectfully.

verses.kjv: And Leah also with her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
verses.decoded: Leah and her children bowed, followed by Rachel and Joseph.

verses.kjv: And he said, What meanest thou by all this drove which I met? And he said, These are to find grace in the sight of my lord.
verses.decoded: Esau asked about the gifts, and Jacob said they were meant to gain his favor.

verses.kjv: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself.
verses.decoded: Esau told Jacob he didn’t need the gifts.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
verses.decoded: Jacob insisted Esau accept the gift, saying Esau’s kindness felt like seeing God’s favor.

verses.kjv: Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
verses.decoded: Jacob urged Esau to accept the gift, explaining God had blessed him abundantly, and Esau accepted.

verses.kjv: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
verses.decoded: Esau suggested they travel together.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and the flocks and herds with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die.
verses.decoded: Jacob explained that his children and animals couldn’t move quickly without harm.

verses.kjv: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
verses.decoded: Jacob asked Esau to go ahead while he traveled slowly at a safe pace.

verses.kjv: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
verses.decoded: Esau offered protection, but Jacob politely declined.

verses.kjv: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
verses.decoded: Esau went back toward Seir.

verses.kjv: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
verses.decoded: Jacob settled temporarily at Succoth and built shelters for his family and livestock.

verses.kjv: And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram; and pitched his tent before the city.
verses.decoded: Jacob arrived safely at Shechem in Canaan and set up camp near the city.

verses.kjv: And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money.
verses.decoded: Jacob purchased land where he camped, securing a legal place to stay.

verses.kjv: And he erected there an altar, and called it Elelohe-Israel.
verses.decoded: Jacob built an altar and named it to honor God as the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
verses.decoded: Dinah, Leah’s daughter, went out to spend time with the local women of the land.

verses.kjv: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.
verses.decoded: Shechem, a local ruler’s son, saw Dinah and violated her.

verses.kjv: And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel.
verses.decoded: Afterward, Shechem became emotionally attached to Dinah and spoke to her affectionately.

verses.kjv: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
verses.decoded: Shechem asked his father to arrange a marriage with Dinah.

verses.kjv: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.
verses.decoded: Jacob learned what had happened but waited to speak until his sons returned.

verses.kjv: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
verses.decoded: Hamor approached Jacob to discuss the situation.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
verses.decoded: Jacob’s sons were deeply upset and angry, believing a serious wrong had been committed against their family.

verses.kjv: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.
verses.decoded: Hamor explained that Shechem wanted to marry Dinah.

verses.kjv: And make ye marriages with us, and give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
verses.decoded: Hamor proposed intermarriage between the two families.

verses.kjv: And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
verses.decoded: He offered shared land, trade opportunities, and prosperity.

verses.kjv: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
verses.decoded: Shechem said he would do whatever was asked to gain their approval.

verses.kjv: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.
verses.decoded: Shechem offered any price, insisting only that he be allowed to marry Dinah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had defiled Dinah their sister:
verses.decoded: Jacob’s sons responded with deception because of what had been done to their sister.

verses.kjv: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:
verses.decoded: They claimed marriage was impossible unless the men adopted their covenant sign.

verses.kjv: But in this will we consent unto you: If ye will be as we be, that every male of you be circumcised;
verses.decoded: They set circumcision as the condition for agreement.

verses.kjv: Then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
verses.decoded: They promised unity and shared life if the condition was met.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
verses.decoded: They said they would leave if the condition was refused.

verses.kjv: And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.
verses.decoded: Hamor and Shechem agreed to the proposal.

verses.kjv: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter: and he was more honourable than all the house of his father.
verses.decoded: Shechem acted quickly, eager to comply, and held high status in his family.

verses.kjv: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
verses.decoded: Hamor and Shechem presented the proposal to the city leaders.

verses.kjv: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
verses.decoded: They described Jacob’s family as peaceful and beneficial partners.

verses.kjv: Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
verses.decoded: Circumcision was presented as the only requirement for unity.

verses.kjv: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
verses.decoded: The men were persuaded by the promise of shared wealth.

verses.kjv: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
verses.decoded: All the men of the city agreed and were circumcised.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.
verses.decoded: While the men were recovering, Simeon and Levi attacked and killed all the males in the city.

verses.kjv: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.
verses.decoded: They killed Hamor and Shechem and rescued Dinah.
