verses.kjv: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
verses.decoded: Jacob’s sons looted the city in retaliation for what had happened.

verses.kjv: They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field,
verses.decoded: They seized livestock and all valuable property.

verses.kjv: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.
verses.decoded: They captured the families and took everything of value.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
verses.decoded: Jacob rebuked them, fearing their actions put the entire family in danger.

verses.kjv: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?
verses.decoded: Simeon and Levi defended their actions, insisting their sister had been dishonored.

verses.kjv: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
verses.decoded: God instructed Jacob to return to Bethel, settle there, and build an altar to honor the God who protected him when he fled from Esau.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:
verses.decoded: Jacob told his household to get rid of foreign gods, cleanse themselves, and change their clothes in preparation to meet God.

verses.kjv: And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
verses.decoded: Jacob explained they were going to worship the God who had helped him during his hardest moments.

verses.kjv: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
verses.decoded: The people handed over their idols and jewelry, and Jacob buried them, symbolizing a clean break from the past.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
verses.decoded: As they traveled, God protected them by causing fear to fall on surrounding cities.

verses.kjv: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.
verses.decoded: Jacob and his household arrived safely at Bethel.

verses.kjv: And he built there an altar, and called the place Elbethel: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
verses.decoded: Jacob built an altar and named the place to honor God, remembering the encounter he had there years earlier.

verses.kjv: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.
verses.decoded: Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died and was buried near Bethel, and the place became associated with mourning.

verses.kjv: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.
verses.decoded: God appeared to Jacob again and reaffirmed His blessing.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
verses.decoded: God officially confirmed Jacob’s new name, Israel.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
verses.decoded: God promised that Jacob’s descendants would become many nations and produce kings.

verses.kjv: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
verses.decoded: God reaffirmed the promise of land given to Abraham and Isaac.

verses.kjv: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
verses.decoded: God departed after speaking with Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
verses.decoded: Jacob marked the encounter by setting up a stone pillar and dedicating it to God.

verses.kjv: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Bethel.
verses.decoded: Jacob named the place Bethel to remember God’s presence there.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.
verses.decoded: While traveling, Rachel went into difficult labor.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
verses.decoded: The midwife encouraged Rachel, telling her she was giving birth to another son.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.
verses.decoded: As Rachel died, she named her son Benoni, but Jacob renamed him Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
verses.decoded: Rachel passed away and was buried near Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.
verses.decoded: Jacob placed a memorial stone on Rachel’s grave.

verses.kjv: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
verses.decoded: Jacob, now called Israel, continued traveling and settled temporarily beyond the tower of Edar.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
verses.decoded: Reuben committed a serious act of betrayal, and Jacob became aware of it. Jacob had twelve sons in total.

verses.kjv: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
verses.decoded: Leah’s sons were Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

verses.kjv: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
verses.decoded: Rachel’s sons were Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:
verses.decoded: Bilhah’s sons were Dan and Naphtali.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padanaram.
verses.decoded: Zilpah’s sons were Gad and Asher, completing Jacob’s twelve sons.

verses.kjv: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
verses.decoded: Jacob returned to his father Isaac in Hebron.

verses.kjv: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
verses.decoded: Isaac lived to be 180 years old.

verses.kjv: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
verses.decoded: Isaac died peacefully at an old age, and both Esau and Jacob buried him together.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.
verses.decoded: This chapter records the family line of Esau, also known as Edom.

verses.kjv: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;
verses.decoded: Esau married women from the Canaanite people.

verses.kjv: And Bashemath Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
verses.decoded: He also married Bashemath, who was part of Ishmael’s family line.

verses.kjv: And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz; and Bashemath bare Reuel;
verses.decoded: Esau had sons named Eliphaz and Reuel through his wives.

verses.kjv: And Aholibamah bare Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, which were born unto him in the land of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Esau had additional sons, all born while he lived in Canaan.

verses.kjv: And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the persons of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of Canaan; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob.
verses.decoded: Esau moved his entire household away from Jacob.

verses.kjv: For their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their cattle.
verses.decoded: Their combined wealth and livestock made it impossible for both families to live together.

verses.kjv: Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.
verses.decoded: Esau settled in the region of Mount Seir, becoming the father of Edom.

verses.kjv: And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:
verses.decoded: This section lists the descendants of Esau in Mount Seir.

verses.kjv: These are the names of Esau's sons; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau.
verses.decoded: Esau’s sons were Eliphaz and Reuel.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.
verses.decoded: Eliphaz had five sons.

verses.kjv: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau's son; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek: these were the sons of Adah Esau's wife.
verses.decoded: Eliphaz also had a son named Amalek through his concubine Timna.

verses.kjv: And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
verses.decoded: Reuel had four sons.

verses.kjv: And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
verses.decoded: Aholibamah bore three sons to Esau.

verses.kjv: These were dukes of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn son of Esau; duke Teman, duke Omar, duke Zepho, duke Kenaz,
verses.decoded: Esau’s descendants became tribal leaders.

verses.kjv: Duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these were the sons of Adah.
verses.decoded: These leaders came from Eliphaz’s family line.

verses.kjv: And these are the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
verses.decoded: Reuel’s sons also became tribal leaders.

verses.kjv: And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau's wife; duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah: these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.
verses.decoded: Aholibamah’s sons likewise became leaders.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Esau, who is Edom, and these are their dukes.
verses.decoded: This summarizes Esau’s leadership lineage.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, who inhabited the land; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,
verses.decoded: The chapter now lists the original inhabitants of the land.

verses.kjv: And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the dukes of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.
verses.decoded: These families ruled the land before Esau’s descendants.

verses.kjv: And the children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.
verses.decoded: Lotan’s family line is recorded.

verses.kjv: And the children of Shobal were these; Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
verses.decoded: Shobal had five sons.

verses.kjv: And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah, and Anah: this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
verses.decoded: Anah was known for discovering a resource while tending livestock.

verses.kjv: And the children of Anah were these; Dishon, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
verses.decoded: Anah’s descendants are listed.

verses.kjv: And these are the children of Dishon; Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
verses.decoded: Dishon had four sons.

verses.kjv: The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.
verses.decoded: Ezer had three sons.

verses.kjv: The children of Dishan are these; Uz, and Aran.
verses.decoded: Dishan had two sons.

verses.kjv: These are the dukes that came of the Horites; duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,
verses.decoded: The Horite leaders are summarized.

verses.kjv: Duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan: these are the dukes that came of Hori, among their dukes in the land of Seir.
verses.decoded: These men governed the region of Seir.

verses.kjv: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.
verses.decoded: Edom had kings long before Israel did.

verses.kjv: And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.decoded: Bela was the first recorded king of Edom.

verses.kjv: And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
verses.decoded: Jobab became king after Bela.

verses.kjv: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
verses.decoded: Husham succeeded Jobab.

verses.kjv: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
verses.decoded: Hadad became king and was known for military victories.

verses.kjv: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
verses.decoded: Samlah succeeded Hadad.

verses.kjv: And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
verses.decoded: Saul became king after Samlah.

verses.kjv: And Saul died, and Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
verses.decoded: Baalhanan succeeded Saul.

verses.kjv: And Baalhanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
verses.decoded: Hadar became king, and his family details are recorded.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
verses.decoded: Esau’s clan leaders are listed by name and region.

verses.kjv: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
verses.decoded: Additional leaders from Esau’s line are named.

verses.kjv: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
verses.decoded: More regional leaders are recorded.

verses.kjv: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these be the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he is Esau the father of the Edomites.
verses.decoded: This concludes the record of Esau’s descendants, the Edomites.

verses.kjv: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Jacob settled in the land of Canaan, where his father had lived as a foreigner.

verses.kjv: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.
verses.decoded: This section begins Jacob’s family story. Joseph, at seventeen, worked with his brothers and reported their wrongdoing to his father.

verses.kjv: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.
verses.decoded: Jacob favored Joseph and showed it by giving him a special, symbolic coat.

verses.kjv: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
verses.decoded: Joseph’s brothers grew bitter and hostile toward him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
verses.decoded: Joseph shared a dream with his brothers, which increased their resentment.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
verses.decoded: Joseph asked his brothers to listen to his dream.

verses.kjv: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.
verses.decoded: Joseph described a dream where his brothers’ work symbolically bowed to his.

verses.kjv: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
verses.decoded: His brothers interpreted the dream as Joseph claiming authority over them and hated him even more.

verses.kjv: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.
verses.decoded: Joseph had another dream showing even greater authority, including his entire family.

verses.kjv: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
verses.decoded: Jacob corrected Joseph for sharing the dream, though he understood its meaning.

verses.kjv: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.
verses.decoded: Joseph’s brothers were jealous, but Jacob quietly reflected on the dream.

verses.kjv: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.
verses.decoded: Joseph’s brothers traveled to Shechem to tend the flocks.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
verses.decoded: Jacob sent Joseph to check on his brothers, and Joseph agreed.

verses.kjv: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
verses.decoded: Joseph was sent to report back on his brothers and the livestock.

verses.kjv: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
verses.decoded: A man found Joseph lost and asked what he was looking for.

verses.kjv: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
verses.decoded: Joseph explained he was searching for his brothers.

verses.kjv: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
verses.decoded: Joseph followed directions and found his brothers in Dothan.

verses.kjv: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
verses.decoded: Seeing Joseph approach, his brothers plotted to kill him.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
verses.decoded: They mocked Joseph as “the dreamer.”

verses.kjv: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
verses.decoded: They planned to murder Joseph and erase his future.

verses.kjv: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
verses.decoded: Reuben intervened to stop them from killing Joseph.

verses.kjv: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.
verses.decoded: Reuben secretly planned to rescue Joseph later.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stript Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;
verses.decoded: They violently removed Joseph’s special coat.

verses.kjv: And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
verses.decoded: Joseph was thrown into an empty pit.

verses.kjv: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
verses.decoded: While eating, they noticed a caravan traveling to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
verses.decoded: Judah suggested selling Joseph instead of killing him.

verses.kjv: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
verses.decoded: The brothers agreed to sell Joseph.

verses.kjv: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
verses.decoded: Joseph was sold into slavery and taken to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
verses.decoded: Reuben was devastated to discover Joseph was gone.

verses.kjv: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
verses.decoded: Reuben panicked, knowing he was responsible.

verses.kjv: And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
verses.decoded: The brothers staged evidence of Joseph’s death.

verses.kjv: And they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be thy son's coat or no.
verses.decoded: They deceived Jacob by showing him the bloodied coat.

verses.kjv: And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
verses.decoded: Jacob believed Joseph had been killed.

verses.kjv: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
verses.decoded: Jacob entered deep mourning for Joseph.

verses.kjv: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
verses.decoded: Jacob grieved intensely and refused comfort.

verses.kjv: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
verses.decoded: Joseph was sold to Potiphar, an Egyptian official, setting the stage for what comes next.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
verses.decoded: Around this time, Judah separated himself from his brothers and formed a friendship with a man named Hirah.

verses.kjv: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
verses.decoded: Judah married a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shuah.

verses.kjv: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
verses.decoded: Judah and his wife had a son named Er.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
verses.decoded: She gave birth to a second son named Onan.

verses.kjv: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
verses.decoded: A third son, Shelah, was born while the family was living in Chezib.

verses.kjv: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
verses.decoded: Judah arranged a marriage between his eldest son Er and a woman named Tamar.

verses.kjv: And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
verses.decoded: Er lived in a way that deeply displeased God, and God ended his life.

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
verses.decoded: Judah instructed Onan to fulfill his duty by providing an heir for his deceased brother.

verses.kjv: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
verses.decoded: Onan intentionally avoided producing a child because the inheritance would not benefit him.

verses.kjv: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
verses.decoded: Onan’s actions angered God, and his life was taken as well.

verses.kjv: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
verses.decoded: Judah told Tamar to wait until Shelah was older, though he secretly feared losing another son.

verses.kjv: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
verses.decoded: After Judah’s wife died and he had finished mourning, he traveled to Timnath with his friend Hirah.

verses.kjv: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
verses.decoded: Tamar was informed that Judah was traveling to Timnath.

verses.kjv: And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
verses.decoded: Tamar disguised herself because Judah had failed to keep his promise to give her Shelah as a husband.

verses.kjv: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
verses.decoded: Judah mistook Tamar for a prostitute because of her disguise.

verses.kjv: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
verses.decoded: Judah approached her without knowing who she was, and she asked for payment.

verses.kjv: And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
verses.decoded: Tamar asked for a guarantee until the payment was delivered.

verses.kjv: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
verses.decoded: Tamar requested Judah’s personal items as collateral, and she became pregnant by him.

verses.kjv: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
verses.decoded: Tamar returned home and resumed her appearance as a widow.

verses.kjv: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
verses.decoded: Judah tried to retrieve his belongings, but Tamar could not be found.

verses.kjv: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.
verses.decoded: The locals denied that any such woman had been there.

verses.kjv: And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
verses.decoded: Judah’s friend reported that the woman could not be located.

verses.kjv: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
verses.decoded: Judah chose to drop the matter to avoid public embarrassment.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
verses.decoded: When Judah heard Tamar was pregnant, he reacted harshly and called for punishment.

verses.kjv: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
verses.decoded: Tamar revealed the truth by presenting Judah’s personal items.

verses.kjv: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
verses.decoded: Judah admitted his wrongdoing and acknowledged Tamar’s righteousness.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
verses.decoded: Tamar was carrying twins.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
verses.decoded: One child appeared first, and a marker was placed on him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
verses.decoded: The second twin was born first and named Pharez, meaning “breakthrough.”

verses.kjv: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.
verses.decoded: The other twin was born afterward and named Zarah.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.
verses.decoded: Joseph was taken to Egypt and sold as a slave to Potiphar, a high-ranking Egyptian official.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
verses.decoded: God was clearly with Joseph, causing him to succeed even as a servant.

verses.kjv: And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
verses.decoded: Potiphar noticed that everything Joseph did succeeded because God was with him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
verses.decoded: Joseph earned Potiphar’s trust and was put in charge of his entire household.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
verses.decoded: God blessed everything Potiphar owned because of Joseph.

verses.kjv: And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.
verses.decoded: Potiphar trusted Joseph completely. Joseph was also physically attractive and well-built.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
verses.decoded: Potiphar’s wife began to desire Joseph and directly propositioned him.

verses.kjv: But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
verses.decoded: Joseph refused, explaining that his master trusted him completely.

verses.kjv: There is none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
verses.decoded: Joseph said giving in would betray his master and be a sin against God.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
verses.decoded: Despite repeated pressure, Joseph continued to resist her advances.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
verses.decoded: One day Joseph was alone in the house while doing his work.

verses.kjv: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
verses.decoded: She grabbed him, but Joseph escaped, leaving his cloak behind.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
verses.decoded: After Joseph fled, she realized she could use the garment against him.

verses.kjv: That she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
verses.decoded: She falsely accused Joseph, claiming he tried to assault her.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
verses.decoded: She used the garment as false evidence to support her story.

verses.kjv: And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
verses.decoded: She kept Joseph’s cloak to present it to her husband.

verses.kjv: And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
verses.decoded: She repeated the lie to Potiphar when he returned.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
verses.decoded: She again pointed to the cloak as proof of her accusation.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
verses.decoded: Potiphar became furious after hearing his wife’s story.

verses.kjv: And Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
verses.decoded: Joseph was unjustly imprisoned where royal prisoners were kept.

verses.kjv: But the LORD was with Joseph, and shewed him mercy, and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
verses.decoded: Even in prison, God stayed with Joseph and caused him to find favor.

verses.kjv: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
verses.decoded: Joseph was put in charge of the other prisoners.

verses.kjv: The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
verses.decoded: The prison keeper trusted Joseph completely because God continued to bless everything Joseph did.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of Egypt.
verses.decoded: After some time, Pharaoh’s cupbearer and baker angered him.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh became furious with both officials.

verses.kjv: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
verses.decoded: They were imprisoned in the same place where Joseph was held.

verses.kjv: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
verses.decoded: Joseph was assigned to take care of them while they were in prison.

verses.kjv: And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
verses.decoded: Both men had dreams on the same night, each with its own meaning.

verses.kjv: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
verses.decoded: Joseph noticed the next morning that they were distressed.

verses.kjv: And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
verses.decoded: Joseph asked why they looked so troubled.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
verses.decoded: Joseph reminded them that God gives interpretations and invited them to share their dreams.

verses.kjv: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
verses.decoded: The cupbearer described seeing a vine in his dream.

verses.kjv: And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
verses.decoded: The vine quickly produced ripe grapes.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.
verses.decoded: He said he squeezed the grapes into Pharaoh’s cup and served him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:
verses.decoded: Joseph explained the dream symbolized three days.

verses.kjv: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
verses.decoded: Joseph told him he would be restored to his position in three days.

verses.kjv: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
verses.decoded: Joseph asked the cupbearer to remember him and speak to Pharaoh on his behalf.

verses.kjv: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
verses.decoded: Joseph explained that he was innocent and wrongfully imprisoned.

verses.kjv: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
verses.decoded: Encouraged, the baker shared his own dream.

verses.kjv: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
verses.decoded: Birds ate baked goods from the basket in his dream.

verses.kjv: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
verses.decoded: Joseph said the baskets also represented three days.

verses.kjv: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
verses.decoded: Joseph revealed the baker would be executed in three days.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
verses.decoded: On Pharaoh’s birthday, both men were brought before him.

verses.kjv: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand:
verses.decoded: The cupbearer was reinstated to his position.

verses.kjv: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
verses.decoded: The baker was executed, exactly as Joseph said.

verses.kjv: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
verses.decoded: Despite his promise, the cupbearer forgot about Joseph.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
verses.decoded: Two years later, Pharaoh had a troubling dream while standing by the Nile River.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
verses.decoded: Seven healthy, strong cows came out of the river and began grazing.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
verses.decoded: Seven sickly, thin cows followed and stood beside the healthy ones.

verses.kjv: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
verses.decoded: The thin cows consumed the healthy cows, shocking Pharaoh awake.

verses.kjv: And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh fell asleep again and dreamed of seven healthy heads of grain on one stalk.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
verses.decoded: Seven thin, wind-scorched heads of grain appeared afterward.

verses.kjv: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
verses.decoded: The thin grain swallowed the healthy grain, and Pharaoh woke up disturbed.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh was deeply unsettled, but none of Egypt’s wise men could explain the dreams.

verses.kjv: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
verses.decoded: The cupbearer suddenly remembered Joseph and admitted his past mistake.

verses.kjv: Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's house, both me and the chief baker:
verses.decoded: He recalled being imprisoned with the baker after angering Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
verses.decoded: Both men had dreams with specific meanings.

verses.kjv: And there was there with us a young man, an Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
verses.decoded: Joseph accurately interpreted both dreams while they were in prison.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
verses.decoded: Everything Joseph predicted came true.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Joseph was quickly cleaned up and brought before Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh explained that he believed Joseph could interpret dreams.

verses.kjv: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
verses.decoded: Joseph made it clear that God—not himself—gives interpretations.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river:
verses.decoded: Pharaoh began retelling his dreams.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favoured; and they fed in a meadow:
verses.decoded: He described the healthy cows.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favoured and leanfleshed; such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
verses.decoded: The second group of cows looked worse than any Pharaoh had ever seen.

verses.kjv: And the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
verses.decoded: The weak cows devoured the strong ones.

verses.kjv: And when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
verses.decoded: Even after eating them, the cows remained thin.

verses.kjv: And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:
verses.decoded: Pharaoh described the healthy grain.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
verses.decoded: The damaged grain followed.

verses.kjv: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told this unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
verses.decoded: Again, no one could explain the meaning.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: God hath shewed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.decoded: Joseph explained that both dreams carried the same message from God.

verses.kjv: The seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
verses.decoded: The healthy images represented seven good years.

verses.kjv: And the seven thin and ill favoured kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine.
verses.decoded: The unhealthy images represented seven years of famine.

verses.kjv: This is the thing which I have spoken unto Pharaoh: What God is about to do he sheweth unto Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: God was warning Pharaoh in advance.

verses.kjv: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:
verses.decoded: Egypt would experience seven years of abundance.

verses.kjv: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
verses.decoded: Seven devastating years of famine would follow.

verses.kjv: And the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it shall be very grievous.
verses.decoded: The famine would erase all memory of prosperity.

verses.kjv: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
verses.decoded: The repeated dreams confirmed God’s certainty.

verses.kjv: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
verses.decoded: Joseph advised appointing a capable leader.

verses.kjv: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
verses.decoded: Joseph proposed a national savings plan.

verses.kjv: And let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh, and let them keep food in the cities.
verses.decoded: Food was to be stored in preparation.

verses.kjv: And that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, that the land perish not through the famine.
verses.decoded: This would save Egypt from destruction.

verses.kjv: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
verses.decoded: Pharaoh approved the plan.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto his servants, Can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom the Spirit of God is?
verses.decoded: Pharaoh recognized God’s presence in Joseph.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath shewed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art:
verses.decoded: Pharaoh declared Joseph uniquely qualified.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
verses.decoded: Joseph was appointed second-in-command.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
verses.decoded: Joseph was given authority over the entire nation.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph's hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
verses.decoded: Joseph received symbols of power and honor.

verses.kjv: And he made him to ride in the second chariot; and they cried before him, Bow the knee.
verses.decoded: Joseph was publicly honored as a ruler.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.
verses.decoded: Joseph had full authority under Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave him to wife Asenath.
verses.decoded: Joseph was given an Egyptian name and married into nobility.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Joseph was 30 years old when he rose to power.

verses.kjv: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
verses.decoded: The land produced abundantly.

verses.kjv: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years.
verses.decoded: Joseph stored massive supplies.

verses.kjv: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea.
verses.decoded: The supply became beyond measure.

verses.kjv: And unto Joseph were born two sons.
verses.decoded: Joseph became a father before the famine.

verses.kjv: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh.
verses.decoded: Manasseh symbolized healing from past pain.

verses.kjv: And the name of the second called he Ephraim.
verses.decoded: Ephraim symbolized fruitfulness after hardship.

verses.kjv: And the seven years of plenteousness were ended.
verses.decoded: The years of abundance ended.

verses.kjv: And the seven years of dearth began.
verses.decoded: The famine began exactly as foretold.

verses.kjv: And when all the land of Egypt was famished.
verses.decoded: The people cried out for food.

verses.kjv: And the famine was over all the face of the earth.
verses.decoded: The crisis spread far beyond Egypt.

verses.kjv: And all countries came into Egypt for Joseph to buy corn.
verses.decoded: Joseph became the source of survival for many nations.

verses.kjv: Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said unto his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
verses.decoded: When Jacob learned food was available in Egypt, he questioned why his sons were doing nothing.

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
verses.decoded: Jacob told his sons to go to Egypt and buy food so the family would survive.

verses.kjv: And Joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
verses.decoded: Ten of Joseph’s brothers traveled to Egypt to purchase food.

verses.kjv: But Benjamin, Joseph's brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure mischief befall him.
verses.decoded: Jacob kept Benjamin at home, fearing he might be harmed.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Israel came to buy corn among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
verses.decoded: Jacob’s sons joined many others seeking food because the famine affected Canaan.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
verses.decoded: Joseph ruled Egypt’s food supply, and his brothers unknowingly bowed before him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them.
verses.decoded: Joseph recognized his brothers but pretended not to know them and spoke harshly.

verses.kjv: And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
verses.decoded: Joseph recognized them, but they did not recognize him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye are spies.
verses.decoded: Joseph remembered his dreams and accused them of being spies.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy servants come.
verses.decoded: The brothers insisted they only came to buy food.

verses.kjv: We are all one man's sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.
verses.decoded: They claimed to be honest men from one family.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
verses.decoded: Joseph repeated his accusation.

verses.kjv: And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren… and one is not.
verses.decoded: They explained they were twelve brothers, one missing, and the youngest at home.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, That is it that I spake unto you, saying, Ye are spies:
verses.decoded: Joseph used their story to reinforce his accusation.

verses.kjv: Hereby ye shall be proved… except your youngest brother come hither.
verses.decoded: Joseph demanded proof by requiring Benjamin to be brought to Egypt.

verses.kjv: Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother…
verses.decoded: One brother would retrieve Benjamin while the rest stayed imprisoned.

verses.kjv: And he put them all together into ward three days.
verses.decoded: Joseph imprisoned them for three days.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them the third day… for I fear God.
verses.decoded: Joseph showed mercy and said he respected God.

verses.kjv: If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound…
verses.decoded: One brother would stay behind while the others took food home.

verses.kjv: But bring your youngest brother unto me…
verses.decoded: Joseph required Benjamin’s return to confirm their honesty.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, We are verily guilty concerning our brother…
verses.decoded: The brothers admitted guilt over how they treated Joseph years earlier.

verses.kjv: And Reuben answered them…
verses.decoded: Reuben reminded them he had warned against harming Joseph.

verses.kjv: And they knew not that Joseph understood them…
verses.decoded: They didn’t realize Joseph understood their conversation.

verses.kjv: And he turned himself about from them, and wept…
verses.decoded: Joseph stepped away and wept privately.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn…
verses.decoded: Joseph secretly returned their money and provided supplies.

verses.kjv: And they laded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
verses.decoded: The brothers left Egypt with food.

verses.kjv: And as one of them opened his sack…
verses.decoded: One brother discovered his money had been returned.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored…
verses.decoded: Fear struck them as they wondered what God was doing.

verses.kjv: And they came unto Jacob their father…
verses.decoded: They returned home and told Jacob everything.

verses.kjv: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us…
verses.decoded: They described Joseph’s harsh treatment.

verses.kjv: And we said unto him, We are true men…
verses.decoded: They defended their honesty.

verses.kjv: We be twelve brethren…
verses.decoded: They explained their family situation again.

verses.kjv: And the man, the lord of the country, said unto us…
verses.decoded: They repeated Joseph’s demand for Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And bring your youngest brother unto me…
verses.decoded: Only then would Simeon be released.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks…
verses.decoded: All the brothers discovered their money returned.

verses.kjv: And Jacob their father said unto them…
verses.decoded: Jacob felt devastated, believing everything was against him.

verses.kjv: And Reuben spake unto his father…
verses.decoded: Reuben offered his own sons as a guarantee.

verses.kjv: And he said, My son shall not go down with you…
verses.decoded: Jacob refused to risk losing Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And the famine was sore in the land.
verses.decoded: The famine became severe.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
verses.decoded: After they ran out of food, Jacob told them to return to Egypt and buy more.

verses.kjv: And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
verses.decoded: Judah reminded Jacob that the Egyptian ruler demanded they bring their youngest brother.

verses.kjv: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
verses.decoded: Judah said they could go only if Benjamin came with them.

verses.kjv: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down…
verses.decoded: Without Benjamin, they refused to return because it was pointless.

verses.kjv: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
verses.decoded: Jacob complained that they should never have mentioned Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state…
verses.decoded: They explained the ruler questioned them intensely, so they answered honestly.

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me…
verses.decoded: Judah urged Jacob to let Benjamin go so the whole family could survive.

verses.kjv: I will be surety for him…
verses.decoded: Judah promised to take full responsibility for Benjamin’s safety.

verses.kjv: For except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time.
verses.decoded: Judah said their delay had already cost them valuable time.

verses.kjv: And their father Israel said unto them, If it must be so now, do this…
verses.decoded: Jacob agreed, and instructed them to bring gifts from Canaan to the ruler.

verses.kjv: And take double money in your hand…
verses.decoded: Jacob told them to bring extra money, including what was returned before.

verses.kjv: Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
verses.decoded: Jacob finally allowed Benjamin to go.

verses.kjv: And God Almighty give you mercy before the man…
verses.decoded: Jacob prayed God would soften the ruler’s heart, even though he feared loss.

verses.kjv: And the men took that present… and Benjamin…
verses.decoded: The brothers took the gifts, double money, and Benjamin, and went to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them…
verses.decoded: Joseph saw Benjamin and ordered a meal prepared for them at his house.

verses.kjv: And the man did as Joseph bade…
verses.decoded: Joseph’s steward brought the brothers into Joseph’s home.

verses.kjv: And the men were afraid…
verses.decoded: The brothers feared they were being trapped because of the money incident.

verses.kjv: And they came near to the steward…
verses.decoded: They spoke to the steward at the door to explain themselves.

verses.kjv: And said, O sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
verses.decoded: They assured him their intentions were honest.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when we came to the inn…
verses.decoded: They explained how they found the returned money in their sacks.

verses.kjv: And other money have we brought down…
verses.decoded: They insisted they didn’t know who put the money there and came prepared to pay.

verses.kjv: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not…
verses.decoded: The steward reassured them and brought Simeon out safely.

verses.kjv: And the man brought the men into Joseph's house…
verses.decoded: They were welcomed, given water, and their animals were fed.

verses.kjv: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon…
verses.decoded: They prepared the gifts, knowing they would eat with Joseph.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph came home…
verses.decoded: When Joseph arrived, they gave him the gifts and bowed before him.

verses.kjv: And he asked them of their welfare…
verses.decoded: Joseph asked about their wellbeing and about their father.

verses.kjv: And they answered, Thy servant our father is in good health…
verses.decoded: They confirmed Jacob was alive and well, and they bowed again.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin…
verses.decoded: Joseph saw Benjamin, blessed him, and showed kindness.

verses.kjv: And Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother…
verses.decoded: Joseph was overwhelmed with emotion and hurried away to cry privately.

verses.kjv: And he washed his face, and went out…
verses.decoded: He composed himself and ordered the meal to begin.

verses.kjv: And they set on for him by himself…
verses.decoded: They ate separately because Egyptians refused to dine with Hebrews.

verses.kjv: And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright…
verses.decoded: The brothers were seated in exact birth order, which shocked them.

verses.kjv: And he took and sent messes unto them…
verses.decoded: Joseph honored Benjamin with a much larger portion, and they celebrated together.

verses.kjv: And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth.
verses.decoded: Joseph instructed his steward to fully supply the brothers with food and secretly return their money.

verses.kjv: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn money.
verses.decoded: Joseph ordered his silver cup to be hidden in Benjamin’s sack.

verses.kjv: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
verses.decoded: At daybreak, the brothers left Egypt with their animals.

verses.kjv: And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men…
verses.decoded: Joseph sent his steward to pursue them shortly after they departed.

verses.kjv: Is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth?
verses.decoded: The steward accused them of stealing Joseph’s valuable silver cup.

verses.kjv: And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
verses.decoded: The steward caught up to them and repeated the accusation.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words?
verses.decoded: The brothers strongly denied the charge.

verses.kjv: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again unto thee…
verses.decoded: They argued they had already proven their honesty by returning the money.

verses.kjv: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die…
verses.decoded: They confidently declared severe punishment if any of them were guilty.

verses.kjv: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words…
verses.decoded: The steward agreed, but said only the guilty one would become a slave.

verses.kjv: Then they speedily took down every man his sack…
verses.decoded: The brothers quickly opened their sacks.

verses.kjv: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest…
verses.decoded: The search ended with Benjamin, where the cup was found.

verses.kjv: Then they rent their clothes…
verses.decoded: Overcome with grief, the brothers tore their clothes and returned to the city.

verses.kjv: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph's house…
verses.decoded: They returned to Joseph’s house and bowed before him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done?
verses.decoded: Joseph confronted them, asserting his authority.

verses.kjv: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord?
verses.decoded: Judah admitted guilt and acknowledged God’s judgment.

verses.kjv: And he said, God forbid that I should do so…
verses.decoded: Joseph stated only Benjamin would remain as a servant.

verses.kjv: Then Judah came near unto him…
verses.decoded: Judah courageously stepped forward to plead.

verses.kjv: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
verses.decoded: Judah recalled how Joseph had questioned them about their family.

verses.kjv: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man…
verses.decoded: Judah explained Jacob’s deep love for Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me…
verses.decoded: Joseph had insisted on seeing Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father…
verses.decoded: Judah explained that Benjamin’s absence would devastate their father.

verses.kjv: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down…
verses.decoded: Judah reminded Joseph of his strict condition.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father…
verses.decoded: Judah described telling Jacob everything.

verses.kjv: And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.
verses.decoded: Jacob later instructed them to return to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And we said, We cannot go down…
verses.decoded: Judah explained they could not go without Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
verses.decoded: Judah spoke of Jacob’s belief that Joseph had died.

verses.kjv: And the one went out from me…
verses.decoded: Jacob believed Joseph was dead and mourned deeply.

verses.kjv: And if ye take this also from me…
verses.decoded: Losing Benjamin would destroy Jacob emotionally.

verses.kjv: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father…
verses.decoded: Judah emphasized how closely Jacob’s life was tied to Benjamin.

verses.kjv: It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us…
verses.decoded: Judah warned that Jacob would die from grief.

verses.kjv: For thy servant became surety for the lad…
verses.decoded: Judah reminded Joseph he had pledged himself for Benjamin.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad…
verses.decoded: Judah offered himself as a slave in Benjamin’s place.

verses.kjv: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me?
verses.decoded: Judah could not bear the thought of breaking his father’s heart.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him…
verses.decoded: Joseph could no longer hold back his emotions and ordered everyone else to leave the room.

verses.kjv: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.
verses.decoded: Joseph wept so loudly that people throughout the palace heard him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live?
verses.decoded: Joseph revealed his identity and immediately asked about his father.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me…
verses.decoded: Joseph invited them closer and confirmed he was the brother they sold into slavery.

verses.kjv: Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves…
verses.decoded: Joseph told them not to blame themselves, explaining God had a greater plan.

verses.kjv: For these two years hath the famine been in the land…
verses.decoded: Joseph explained the famine was far from over.

verses.kjv: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity…
verses.decoded: Joseph said God sent him ahead to save their family line.

verses.kjv: So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God…
verses.decoded: Joseph emphasized that God—not his brothers—was ultimately in control.

verses.kjv: Haste ye, and go up to my father…
verses.decoded: Joseph urged them to quickly bring their father to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen…
verses.decoded: Joseph promised they would live near him in a fertile region.

verses.kjv: And there will I nourish thee…
verses.decoded: Joseph assured them he would provide for them through the famine.

verses.kjv: And, behold, your eyes see…
verses.decoded: Joseph reminded them they were hearing the truth directly from him.

verses.kjv: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt…
verses.decoded: He instructed them to tell Jacob everything they had seen.

verses.kjv: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin's neck, and wept…
verses.decoded: Joseph and Benjamin embraced and wept together.

verses.kjv: Moreover he kissed all his brethren…
verses.decoded: Joseph forgave and embraced all his brothers.

verses.kjv: And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh's house…
verses.decoded: News of the reunion reached Pharaoh and pleased him.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren…
verses.decoded: Pharaoh encouraged Joseph’s family to move to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And take your father and your households…
verses.decoded: Pharaoh promised them the best of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Now thou art commanded, this do ye…
verses.decoded: Pharaoh provided wagons to transport their families.

verses.kjv: Also regard not your stuff…
verses.decoded: They were told not to worry about their possessions.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did so…
verses.decoded: Joseph supplied them with wagons and provisions.

verses.kjv: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment…
verses.decoded: Joseph gave generous gifts, especially to Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And to his father he sent after this manner…
verses.decoded: Joseph sent abundant supplies to support Jacob’s journey.

verses.kjv: So he sent his brethren away…
verses.decoded: Joseph urged them to stay united and not quarrel.

verses.kjv: And they went up out of Egypt…
verses.decoded: The brothers returned to Canaan.

verses.kjv: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive…
verses.decoded: They told Jacob that Joseph was alive and ruling Egypt.

verses.kjv: And they told him all the words of Joseph…
verses.decoded: Jacob’s spirit revived when he saw proof.

verses.kjv: And Israel said, It is enough…
verses.decoded: Overcome with joy, Jacob resolved to see Joseph before he died.

verses.kjv: And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of his father Isaac.
verses.decoded: Jacob set out for Egypt and stopped at Beersheba to worship God and offer sacrifices.

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob.
verses.decoded: God spoke to Jacob in a night vision and called him by name.

verses.kjv: And he said, I am God, the God of thy father: fear not to go down into Egypt…
verses.decoded: God reassured Jacob not to be afraid of going to Egypt, promising to make his family a great nation there.

verses.kjv: I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again…
verses.decoded: God promised to be with Jacob in Egypt and to bring his descendants back, assuring him Joseph would be with him at his death.

verses.kjv: And Jacob rose up from Beersheba…
verses.decoded: Jacob continued the journey, traveling with his entire family in wagons provided by Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And they took their cattle, and their goods…
verses.decoded: Jacob and his family brought everything they owned into Egypt.

verses.kjv: His sons, and his sons' sons with him…
verses.decoded: Jacob brought his entire family—children and grandchildren—into Egypt.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt…
verses.decoded: Scripture records the names of Jacob’s family who entered Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Reuben…
verses.decoded: Reuben’s sons were Hanoch, Phallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Simeon…
verses.decoded: Simeon’s sons included Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Levi…
verses.decoded: Levi’s sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Judah…
verses.decoded: Judah’s lineage continued through Pharez and Zerah, since Er and Onan had died.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Issachar…
verses.decoded: Issachar’s sons were Tola, Phuvah, Job, and Shimron.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Zebulun…
verses.decoded: Zebulun’s sons were Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

verses.kjv: These be the sons of Leah…
verses.decoded: Leah’s descendants totaled thirty-three people, including Dinah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Gad…
verses.decoded: Gad’s sons were Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Asher…
verses.decoded: Asher’s family included sons and a daughter named Serah.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Zilpah…
verses.decoded: Zilpah’s descendants totaled sixteen people.

verses.kjv: The sons of Rachel Jacob's wife…
verses.decoded: Rachel’s sons were Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim…
verses.decoded: Joseph’s sons, Manasseh and Ephraim, were born in Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Benjamin were…
verses.decoded: Benjamin had ten sons.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Rachel…
verses.decoded: Rachel’s descendants totaled fourteen people.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Dan…
verses.decoded: Dan had one son named Hushim.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Naphtali…
verses.decoded: Naphtali’s sons were Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Bilhah…
verses.decoded: Bilhah’s descendants totaled seven people.

verses.kjv: All the souls that came with Jacob into Egypt…
verses.decoded: Sixty-six direct descendants of Jacob entered Egypt, excluding wives.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Joseph… were two souls…
verses.decoded: Including Joseph’s sons, the total number was seventy.

verses.kjv: And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph…
verses.decoded: Judah went ahead to prepare the way into Goshen.

verses.kjv: And Joseph made ready his chariot…
verses.decoded: Joseph rushed to meet his father and embraced him with deep emotion.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Now let me die…
verses.decoded: Jacob said his life was fulfilled now that he had seen Joseph alive.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren…
verses.decoded: Joseph explained he would inform Pharaoh of their arrival.

verses.kjv: And the men are shepherds…
verses.decoded: Joseph planned to explain that his family were shepherds with livestock.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you…
verses.decoded: Joseph prepared them for Pharaoh’s questions.

verses.kjv: That ye shall say, Thy servants' trade hath been about cattle…
verses.decoded: Joseph instructed them to state their occupation so they could live separately in Goshen.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brethren… are come out of the land of Canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of Goshen.
verses.decoded: Joseph informed Pharaoh that his family had arrived from Canaan and were now settled in Goshen.

verses.kjv: And he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Joseph selected five of his brothers and introduced them to Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto his brethren, What is your occupation?
verses.decoded: Pharaoh asked Joseph’s brothers what kind of work they did.

verses.kjv: They said moreover unto Pharaoh, For to sojourn in the land are we come…
verses.decoded: They explained they were shepherds seeking temporary refuge because the famine in Canaan was severe.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee:
verses.decoded: Pharaoh acknowledged that Joseph’s family had arrived.

verses.kjv: The land of Egypt is before thee…
verses.decoded: Pharaoh gave Joseph permission to settle his family in the best land, Goshen, and to appoint capable men over his livestock.

verses.kjv: And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Joseph introduced his father Jacob to Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed him.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Jacob, How old art thou?
verses.decoded: Pharaoh asked Jacob his age.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years…
verses.decoded: Jacob told Pharaoh he was 130 years old and described his life as difficult compared to his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from before Pharaoh.
verses.decoded: Jacob blessed Pharaoh again and then departed.

verses.kjv: And Joseph placed his father and his brethren…
verses.decoded: Joseph settled his family in the fertile land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had ordered.

verses.kjv: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren…
verses.decoded: Joseph ensured his entire family was provided with food.

verses.kjv: And there was no bread in all the land…
verses.decoded: The famine was so severe that Egypt and Canaan were nearly collapsing from hunger.

verses.kjv: And Joseph gathered up all the money…
verses.decoded: Joseph collected all the money people used to buy grain and brought it into Pharaoh’s treasury.

verses.kjv: And when money failed…
verses.decoded: When people ran out of money, they begged Joseph for food to survive.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said, Give your cattle…
verses.decoded: Joseph told them to trade their livestock for food.

verses.kjv: And they brought their cattle unto Joseph…
verses.decoded: The people exchanged their animals for food and survived that year.

verses.kjv: When that year was ended…
verses.decoded: The next year, the people returned, having nothing left except their land and their lives.

verses.kjv: Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes…?
verses.decoded: They asked Joseph to buy their land and themselves in exchange for food, offering lifelong service to Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh…
verses.decoded: Joseph purchased all the land for Pharaoh, as the famine forced everyone to sell their property.

verses.kjv: And as for the people, he removed them to cities…
verses.decoded: Joseph relocated the people throughout Egypt to manage resources more effectively.

verses.kjv: Only the land of the priests bought he not…
verses.decoded: The priests kept their land because Pharaoh provided for them directly.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this day…
verses.decoded: Joseph explained that Pharaoh now owned the land and gave them seed to farm it.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the increase…
verses.decoded: The people were required to give one-fifth of their harvest to Pharaoh and keep the rest.

verses.kjv: And they said, Thou hast saved our lives…
verses.decoded: The people expressed gratitude and willingly became Pharaoh’s servants.

verses.kjv: And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt…
verses.decoded: Joseph established this system as law, except for the priests’ land.

verses.kjv: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt…
