verses.decoded: Jacob’s family prospered in Goshen and grew rapidly.

verses.kjv: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years…
verses.decoded: Jacob lived in Egypt for seventeen years, reaching the age of 147.

verses.kjv: And the time drew nigh that Israel must die…
verses.decoded: As Jacob neared death, he asked Joseph to promise not to bury him in Egypt.

verses.kjv: But I will lie with my fathers…
verses.decoded: Jacob asked to be buried with his ancestors in their homeland.

verses.kjv: And he said, Swear unto me…
verses.decoded: Joseph swore to honor his father’s request, and Jacob bowed in worship.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that one told Joseph, Behold, thy father is sick…
verses.decoded: Joseph was told that his father Jacob was ill, so he went to see him and brought his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And one told Jacob, and said, Behold, thy son Joseph cometh unto thee…
verses.decoded: Jacob was informed that Joseph was coming, and he gathered his strength and sat up in bed.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Joseph, God Almighty appeared unto me at Luz…
verses.decoded: Jacob reminded Joseph of how God appeared to him at Luz (Bethel) and blessed him.

verses.kjv: And said unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful…
verses.decoded: God promised Jacob many descendants and an everlasting inheritance of the land.

verses.kjv: And now thy two sons, Ephraim and Manasseh… are mine…
verses.decoded: Jacob adopted Joseph’s two sons as his own, granting them equal status with his firstborn sons.

verses.kjv: And thy issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine…
verses.decoded: Any future children of Joseph would belong to Joseph’s household, not counted among the tribes.

verses.kjv: And as for me, when I came from Padan, Rachel died by me…
verses.decoded: Jacob recalled the sorrow of Rachel’s death and her burial near Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And Israel beheld Joseph's sons, and said, Who are these?
verses.decoded: Jacob asked who the two young men with Joseph were.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his father, They are my sons…
verses.decoded: Joseph explained they were his sons, gifts from God, and brought them close to be blessed.

verses.kjv: Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age…
verses.decoded: Jacob’s eyesight was failing, so Joseph brought the boys close, and Jacob hugged and kissed them.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, I had not thought to see thy face…
verses.decoded: Jacob expressed gratitude that he was able to see not only Joseph again, but also his children.

verses.kjv: And Joseph brought them out from between his knees…
verses.decoded: Joseph respectfully positioned his sons and bowed before his father.

verses.kjv: And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand…
verses.decoded: Joseph arranged his sons so that Manasseh, the firstborn, would receive the greater blessing.

verses.kjv: And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it upon Ephraim's head…
verses.decoded: Jacob knowingly crossed his hands and placed the greater blessing on Ephraim, the younger son.

verses.kjv: And he blessed Joseph, and said, God, before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk…
verses.decoded: Jacob praised God for guiding and sustaining him throughout his life.

verses.kjv: The Angel which redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads…
verses.decoded: Jacob prayed that God would bless the boys and cause them to grow into a great people.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim…
verses.decoded: Joseph tried to correct Jacob, thinking he had made a mistake.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his father, Not so, my father…
verses.decoded: Joseph reminded his father that Manasseh was the firstborn.

verses.kjv: And his father refused, and said, I know it, my son, I know it…
verses.decoded: Jacob explained that although Manasseh would be great, Ephraim would surpass him.

verses.kjv: And he blessed them that day, saying…
verses.decoded: Jacob established Ephraim as the greater blessing and set him ahead of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Behold, I die…
verses.decoded: Jacob assured Joseph that God would remain with them and return them to their ancestral land.

verses.kjv: Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brethren…
verses.decoded: Jacob gave Joseph an extra inheritance, taken through strength and victory.

verses.kjv: And Jacob called unto his sons, and said, Gather yourselves together…
verses.decoded: Jacob gathered his sons to speak prophetically about their future and the generations to come.

verses.kjv: Gather yourselves together, and hear, ye sons of Jacob…
verses.decoded: He urged them to listen closely to the words of their father, Israel.

verses.kjv: Reuben, thou art my firstborn, my might…
verses.decoded: Jacob acknowledged Reuben’s position as firstborn and the strength he once represented.

verses.kjv: Unstable as water, thou shalt not excel…
verses.decoded: Because of Reuben’s past sin, he would lose the honor and leadership of the firstborn.

verses.kjv: Simeon and Levi are brethren; instruments of cruelty…
verses.decoded: Simeon and Levi were united in violent behavior.

verses.kjv: O my soul, come not thou into their secret…
verses.decoded: Jacob distanced himself from their violent actions and decisions.

verses.kjv: Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce…
verses.decoded: Their anger would cost them unity and land; they would be scattered among Israel.

verses.kjv: Judah, thou art he whom thy brethren shall praise…
verses.decoded: Judah was destined for leadership, honor, and victory over enemies.

verses.kjv: Judah is a lion’s whelp…
verses.decoded: Judah was compared to a powerful lion—strong, fearless, and dominant.

verses.kjv: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah…
verses.decoded: Kingship would come from Judah, pointing forward to the coming Messiah.

verses.kjv: Binding his foal unto the vine…
verses.decoded: Judah’s future would be marked by abundance and prosperity.

verses.kjv: His eyes shall be red with wine…
verses.decoded: A poetic image of health, wealth, and blessing.

verses.kjv: Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea…
verses.decoded: Zebulun would live near trade routes and ports, benefiting from commerce.

verses.kjv: Issachar is a strong ass couching down…
verses.decoded: Issachar would be strong but inclined toward comfort over leadership.

verses.kjv: And he saw that rest was good…
verses.decoded: Issachar would choose stability, even if it meant servitude.

verses.kjv: Dan shall judge his people…
verses.decoded: Dan would play a role in justice among Israel.

verses.kjv: Dan shall be a serpent by the way…
verses.decoded: Dan would use cunning and strategy rather than strength.

verses.kjv: I have waited for thy salvation, O LORD.
verses.decoded: A pause in prophecy where Jacob expresses trust in God’s deliverance.

verses.kjv: Gad, a troop shall overcome him…
verses.decoded: Gad would face attacks but ultimately prevail.

verses.kjv: Out of Asher his bread shall be fat…
verses.decoded: Asher would enjoy abundance and prosperity.

verses.kjv: Naphtali is a hind let loose…
verses.decoded: Naphtali would be free-spirited and gifted in expression.

verses.kjv: Joseph is a fruitful bough…
verses.decoded: Joseph’s life would overflow with growth, influence, and blessing.

verses.kjv: The archers have sorely grieved him…
verses.decoded: Joseph endured severe opposition and betrayal.

verses.kjv: But his bow abode in strength…
verses.decoded: God sustained Joseph and strengthened him through hardship.

verses.kjv: Even by the God of thy father…
verses.decoded: Joseph would receive blessings from every direction—heaven, earth, and family.

verses.kjv: The blessings of thy father have prevailed…
verses.decoded: Joseph’s blessings surpassed those of previous generations.

verses.kjv: Benjamin shall ravin as a wolf…
verses.decoded: Benjamin’s tribe would be fierce, bold, and victorious.

verses.kjv: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel…
verses.decoded: Each son received a unique blessing shaping the twelve tribes.

verses.kjv: And he charged them, and said unto them…
verses.decoded: Jacob instructed his sons on his burial wishes.

verses.kjv: In the cave that is in the field of Machpelah…
verses.decoded: He specified the family burial place in Canaan.

verses.kjv: There they buried Abraham and Sarah…
verses.decoded: Jacob referenced the legacy of his ancestors.

verses.kjv: The purchase of the field and of the cave…
verses.decoded: He affirmed the land was lawfully owned.

verses.kjv: And when Jacob had made an end…
verses.decoded: Jacob peacefully passed away and was reunited with his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And Joseph fell upon his father's face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
verses.decoded: Joseph openly grieved for his father, showing deep love and sorrow.

verses.kjv: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father…
verses.decoded: Joseph arranged for Jacob’s body to be preserved according to Egyptian custom.

verses.kjv: And forty days were fulfilled for him…
verses.decoded: Jacob was honored with a full embalming process, and Egypt mourned him for seventy days.

verses.kjv: And when the days of his mourning were past…
verses.decoded: After the mourning period, Joseph respectfully asked Pharaoh for permission to bury his father in Canaan.

verses.kjv: My father made me swear…
verses.decoded: Joseph explained that he had promised Jacob to bury him in their ancestral land.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father…
verses.decoded: Pharaoh honored Joseph’s request and released him to fulfill his vow.

verses.kjv: And Joseph went up to bury his father…
verses.decoded: A large and dignified procession accompanied Joseph, including Egyptian leaders.

verses.kjv: And all the house of Joseph…
verses.decoded: The family traveled together, leaving their children and livestock safely in Goshen.

verses.kjv: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen…
verses.decoded: The burial procession was massive and highly respected.

verses.kjv: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad…
verses.decoded: They paused to mourn deeply for seven days.

verses.kjv: And when the inhabitants of the land…
verses.decoded: The Canaanites recognized the mourning as extraordinary and named the place accordingly.

verses.kjv: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them:
verses.decoded: Jacob’s sons honored his final wishes exactly as he instructed.

verses.kjv: For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan…
verses.decoded: Jacob was buried in the family tomb purchased by Abraham.

verses.kjv: And Joseph returned into Egypt…
verses.decoded: After the burial, Joseph and his family returned to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph's brethren saw that their father was dead…
verses.decoded: Joseph’s brothers feared he might now seek revenge.

verses.kjv: And they sent a messenger unto Joseph…
verses.decoded: They reminded Joseph of their father’s request for forgiveness.

verses.kjv: Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren…
verses.decoded: Hearing this broke Joseph’s heart, and he wept.

verses.kjv: And his brethren also went and fell down before his face…
verses.decoded: They humbled themselves before him, offering their service.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?
verses.decoded: Joseph reminded them that judgment belongs to God, not him.

verses.kjv: But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good…
verses.decoded: Joseph acknowledged their wrongdoing but emphasized that God used it to save lives.

verses.kjv: Now therefore fear ye not…
verses.decoded: Joseph reassured them and promised to care for their families.

verses.kjv: And Joseph dwelt in Egypt…
verses.decoded: Joseph lived a long life in Egypt, seeing multiple generations.

verses.kjv: And Joseph saw Ephraim's children of the third generation…
verses.decoded: He experienced the blessing of legacy and family growth.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die…
verses.decoded: Before dying, Joseph reminded them that God would one day bring them back to the promised land.

verses.kjv: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel…
verses.decoded: He made them promise to carry his bones with them when God delivered them.

verses.kjv: So Joseph died, being an hundred and ten years old…
verses.decoded: Joseph died in Egypt, preserved with faith that God’s promise would be fulfilled.
